programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete is in Louisiana to take on his biggest treehouse ever. Totalling 1200 square feet, it will comprise of three separate levels and a 70 foot bridge.

programme.title: Animal Cribs

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: When trainee agent Derrick Schlitter responds to an emergency call in north Philadelphia, he ends up seeking justice for a puppy left dead in a backyard.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: When officers raid an illegal cockfighting ring, the quest for justice uncovers a shocking case of deliberate cruelty. But the birds owner denies any wrongdoing.

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier

programme.title: I Was Prey

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Parents Greg and Dina have three loving children and one vicious cat named Mia. Plus, the only thing keeping Chris and Tenille from moving in together is her hostile cat.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Country Matt returns to help his brother, a new parolee, overcome his fear of dogs; Earl and Tias daughter-in-law race to save a stray running loose.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Tia hires 3 new parolees, but things quickly take a turn for the worse. A rural shelter threatened with closure needs Tias help.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: The rescue team gets a call for help to assist a stray dog trying to deliver puppies. With two pups delivered alive and more to come, will she get help in time?

programme.title: The Bronx Zoo
programme.desc: A female slow loris has weight problems that stop her from becoming pregnant. Keepers take the penguin colony for a CT scan and an ocopy has pain in his hooves.

programme.title: The Bronx Zoo
programme.desc: A young otter, Monty, has trouble chewing his food after a potential tooth infection. Plus, the keepers share how they care for the zoos three female elephants.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff visits a free clinic and returns with a dog who was hit by a car. Plus, he helps a dog with a mysterious lump and Dr. Baier wants to keep a rescue puppy.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff treats a cherished Bloodhound puppy that wont eat. Plus, Dr. Petra comes to the rescue of a cat after it swallowed a handful of hair ties.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert feeds 44 hungry alligators, all at the same time. Terri helps examine Kaitlyn the tiger and makes a thrilling discovery.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Steve Irwin loved sea turtles. Terri and Robert continue his legacy as they transport three rescued sea turtles to Lady Elliot Island on the Great Barrier Reef - for the first time, by air. This complex mission is vital in order to help conserve these beautiful but endangered animals. While Robert and Terri take to the skies, Bindi and the team are nervously waiting for the birth of Australia Zoos first Sumatran tiger cub in three years. Richie from the rescue unit helps with a baby wallabys struggle for survival.

programme.title: The Aquarium
programme.desc: A sea otter is rushed to the health centre and a sea lion receives training. The team is in Key Largo to help the coral restoration project.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Former adopters want a puppy Tania rescued at birth, but Tia is unsure he will fit in with their other dog. When a local is arrested, VRC helps his dog left behind.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Marco and Aimee recently got married, but Marcos cat, Monty, is tearing them apart with his appetite for destruction - and will eat everything in sight.

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: A dedicated caregiver gets her lifelong wish of having her own pool. The pressure is on for Lucas to build a dream pool, but in a small backyard.

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: Designer Antonio Ballatore and his team build a cats-only treehouse. Linked to the family room, Taffy and her ten-year-old owner can now play in style.

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: How do koalas keep cool in the Australian sun? How do elephants communicate when they are miles apart? Experts answer these questions!

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: What are cats trying to communicate to humans? Why have some of the worlds cleverest monkeys turned to a life of crime? Experts answer these questions and more!

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Journey around the world and discover how dogs became one of the most valued animals on the planet. From wild predators to friendly pets- this is the story of mans best friend.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Las Vegas Coin Laundry is requesting an aquarium that will knock their customers socks off. A tank built into a real washer/dryer unit just like the others in their store! Across town an Optometrist wants an eye-popping underwater world for their patients

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Wayde and Brett go head to head in a mission to build a one-of-a-kind, extreme pond in their backyard - and only one family can reign supreme!

programme.title: In Search Of Monsters
programme.desc: A team of researchers seeks answers to mysteries surrounded the Mothman. They explore theories that the legendary cryptid is an abnormality in the evolutionary chain.

programme.title: Into the Shark Bite
programme.desc: Go literally inside a sharks jaws as cameras go onto and into the most fearsome predator in the seas to show exactly what it is like to be at the business end of a shark.

programme.title: Saved By The Barn
programme.desc: As summer arrives, the team host a car wash to raise money for cows and donkeys. Meanwhile, Dan goes on a covert mission to save an injured goat.

programme.title: Meet The Orangutans
programme.desc: One orphan needs another, more experienced one to help them bed in. The babies are at high risk from parasites ingested from the ground.

programme.title: Meet The Orangutans
programme.desc: Orphaned orangutan Peanut is one of the newest and youngest arrivals at the sanctuary. He has made friends with Beryl, but he is feeling unwell.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: A family who dedicate their time rescuing animals in Australia, release Crickey the koala back into the wild after a year of nursing him back to health.

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Journey around the world and discover how dogs became one of the most valued animals on the planet. From wild predators to friendly pets- this is the story of mans best friend.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The displaced Browns struggle through a devastating transition as Ami undergoes tests after health concerns. And Noah braves the wilderness to defend the homestead.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: A major diagnosis shakes the Browns, forcing them to a decision that could change their lifelong journey. And oldest son Matt tries to adjust as he reunites with Noah.

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: How do koalas keep cool in the Australian sun? How do elephants communicate when they are miles apart? Experts answer these questions!

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: What are cats trying to communicate to humans? Why have some of the worlds cleverest monkeys turned to a life of crime? Experts answer these questions and more!

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators respond to a report of an injured dog. Events take a dramatic turn when they arrive to discover the dogs paw has been almost completely severed.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Liz Pavlicek visits a house where more than 30 spaniels have suffered neglect. The team works to rescue the animals but are shocked by their condition.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: When a dog is found hanging by her neck in a yard the SPCA tries to save her. And investigators rush to reunite some pups with their mother before its too late.

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: The students are halfway through their spring semester rotations. Lindsay has a hectic week treating a mare and foal for pneumonia.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: In the Mexican desert Bradley Trevor Greive and Billy Almon track down and test the almost supernatural abilities of the giant horned lizard.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: The team scours the Sonoran Desert for North Americas carnivorous grasshopper mouse. Its bite and vertical leap turn it into a vicious scorpion killer at night.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff and the team head to a remote town offering low-cost care to pets. Plus, Dr. Petra performs life-saving surgery on a Basset Hound that was hit by a car.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Shelter volunteers drive from Kansas hoping the team can save a tiny rescue dog. Dr Jeffs cousin asks for the vets to visit Tennessee to provide free care.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert takes part in a research experiment involving a Komodo dragon, while Terri does her best to save a koala that has been given little prospect of survival.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: As Bindi celebrates her 21st birthday, she gets a surprise proposal from her boyfriend. Meanwhile, things get dangerous as Robert wrangles gators in thick mud.

programme.title: The Aquarium
programme.desc: Trainers get two rescued sea lions ready for eye surgery. Meanwhile, intelligent giant octopus, Ophelia, needs attention and the team head to the Bahamas.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: A VRC senior dog finally gets the chance to have a forever home when a couple from Idaho come to New Orleans to find a new family member.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Reality series following behavioural expert Jackson Galaxy, who comes to the aid of more desperate cat owners. George and Beth are prisoners in their own home due to their vicious kitty, Reese. The feisty feline is a cat version of Jack the Ripper and Beth is one of his choice targets

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: Antonio transforms a cramped condo for two cats and a rescue dog. His team builds personalised spaces into the furniture, and install a 20 ft climbing wall.

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: Antonio and team transform a health-hazard yard into a dog-friendly escape, complete with paw-operat

programme.title: Extinct Or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest combs the Florida Everglades for the black panther, which has never been seen in the US. Discoveries in the area suggest it may be more than a rumour.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Wayde and Brett are asked to create two tanks for hip-hop megastar Akons dream house - but their own dreams of musical stardom look set to derail the build.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: The San Francisco Giants want to bring McCovey Cove inside the ballpark! Can the guys build a tank big enough to impress their loyal fans?

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Basketball legend, Dwight Howard, needs the guys at ATM to design and build a habitat for all 14 of his snakes. And he wants a reptile mansion!

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: Four groups of ordinary people are attempting to survive in the Alaskan wilderness. Carolyn Wise heads out on a moose hunt and the Flower Lake group stalks squirrels. The other groups are forced to take desperate measures to find food.

programme.title: Animal ER
programme.desc: Emergency vet Gerard works fast to help Indie the whippet, whos been rushed in with severe breathing difficulties. It looks bleak when Indies X-rays reveal a serious problem.

programme.title: Saved By The Barn
programme.desc: The barn joins forces with a charity to find homes for four neglected calves. Meanwhile, a litter of piglets are born and Chris builds a playground for the goats.

programme.title: Gamechangers: Inventing The World
programme.desc: Scientists around the world are working on projects dealing with space and space travel - extraterrestrial life, colonising Mars, the Big Bang and rocket development.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: British Marine Pen Farthing runs Afghanistans only official animal sanctuary. Hes determined to reunite six dogs with the solider who saved them in Texas.

programme.title: Bad Dog
programme.desc: A dog loves all things ice cream and another dog keeps getting his head stuck in things. Plus, a parrot has a habit of rapping and swearing.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The family prepares to close down Browntown following Amis diagnosis. Meanwhile, Bear, Bird and Rain leave the California heat to return to Alaska.

programme.title: Jorja Smith und John Legend - Jazzopen Stuttgart 2022
programme.desc: Mit 50.000 Besuchern aus ganz Europa, rund 60 Auftritten internationaler Stars sowie talentierter Newcomer ist das zehntagige Festival seit seiner Grundung 1994 immer attraktiver geworden und zahlt inzwischen zu den bedeutendsten Festivals Europas. Es genieSSt die Anerkennung von Kunstlerinnen und Kennern der Musikszene gleichermaSSen. Ein Mitschnitt des Jazzopen 2022 zeigt die Performances von Jorja Smith und John Legend als einstundiges Best-of.

programme.title: Sommer auf drei Radern
programme.desc: Was braucht man um glucklich zu sein? Der schuchterne AuSSenseiter Flake trifft am Abend der Abi-Party einige gewagte Entscheidungen. Und lernt die Drogendealerin Kim und den verbitterten Rollstuhlfahrer Philipp kennen. -

programme.title: Die Bienenflusterer
programme.desc: In 15 Geschichten zeigt die Dokureihe die Schonheit und Vielfalt der Bienenvolker. In dieser Folge: In den Nilgiri-Bergen, im Sudwesten Indiens, warten jedes Jahr traditionelle Honigsammler auf die Ankunft der indischen Wanderbiene Apis Dorsata. Es handelt sich um die groSSte und aggressivste Bienenart der Welt, die ihre Nester unter Felsuberhangen und in Baumwipfeln baut.

programme.title: Mit offenen Karten
programme.desc: Zwischen Silicon Valley und Peking tobt der Konkurrenzkampf um die kunstliche Intelligenz. Um sich die Vormachtstellung in der zukunftstrachtigen Branche zu sichern, investieren die US-amerikanischen und chinesischen Tech-Riesen gigantische Summen. Dabei geht es vor allem um generative KI-Modelle zur Erzeugung von Texten, Bildern und Musik. Diese technologische Revolution ist von strategischer Tragweite, wirft aber auch zahlreiche ethische Fragen auf.

programme.title: Bilder allein zuhaus
programme.desc: Emmanuel Macron hat eine geniale Idee: Die „Mona Lisa“ soll an die USA verkauft werden, um Frankreich aus dem finanziellen Engpass zu helfen. Ihr Agent ruft die beruhmte Diva an, um sie von dem Angebot zu uberzeugen: 50 Milliarden Euro fur die Rettung Frankreichs. Kann man so ein Angebot ausschlagen?

programme.title: 28 Minuten
programme.desc: Die besten Momente aus „28 Minuten”: Die Biologin Pascale Cossart erklart Antibiotikaresistenz. Die Seglerin Isabelle Autissier ruft zum Handeln fur den Schutz der Ozeane auf. Gaëlle Paty blickt zuruck auf den Prozess um die Ermordung ihres Bruders Samuel Paty. Der iranische Filmemacher Jafar Panahi spricht uber „Un simple accident“ (Ein einfacher Unfall), Gewinner der Goldenen Palme 2025.

programme.title: Die Bienenflusterer
programme.desc: In 15 Geschichten von funf Kontinenten zeigt die Dokureihe die Schonheit und Vielfalt der Bienenvolker. In dieser Folge: In der pflanzlichen Vielfalt des nepalesischen Annapurna-Massivs haben sich besondere Bewohner eingenistet: die Riesenbienen Apis laboriosa. Alle Jahre wieder bauen die Insekten an felsigen Überhangen ein einziges, groSSes Nest.

programme.title: Felix Vallotton, Maler der Klassischen Moderne
programme.desc: Auch 100 Jahre nach seinem Tod hat die Kunst von Felix Vallotton (1865-1925) nichts von ihrer Kraft und Modernitat eingebuSSt. Der Maler konfrontierte den Betrachter mit dessen Sehnsuchten, Ängsten und Trieben. Die Dokumentation versucht, dem unergrundlichen Kunstler und seinem Werk auf den Grund zu gehen und durch neue Zugange und Archivmaterial sein Geheimnis zu luften.

programme.title: "Onkel Toms Hutte" - Vom Helden zum Verrater
programme.desc: "Onkel Toms Hutte" zahlt zu den meistverkauften Buchern des 19. Jahrhunderts. Der Roman von 1852 ist ein Meilenstein im Kampf gegen die Sklaverei. Doch rassistische Vorurteile, die durch das Buch und seine zahlreichen Adaptionen thematisiert werden, fuhrten dazu, dass der Begriff "Onkel Tom" seit der Malcom-X-Bewegung zu einer der schlimmsten Beleidigungen unter Afroamerikanern wurde.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Die Provinz Jujuy liegt im Nordwesten Argentiniens, direkt an den majestatischen Anden. Abseits von Stadten und groSSeren Siedlungen leben einige Andenbewohner in dieser Region sehr isoliert, oft hoch in den Bergen. Doch auch sie brauchen regelmaSSige medizinische Versorgung. Mehrmals im Jahr macht sich Dr. Jorge Fusaro auf den beschwerlichen Weg in entlegene Andensiedlungen. Die Menschen dort erwarten ihren Arzt schon sehnsuchtig.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Seit jeher wird Rattan in Asien vielseitig verwendet: zur Herstellung von Mobeln, Korbwaren, Wandverkleidungen und Sportballen. Auch im bergreichen Zentrum von Laos gedeiht die stachelige Rattanpalme. Wild als Kletterliane in den Dschungelwaldern und auch angebaut auf Feldern. Die Menschen in den Dorfern ringsum leben seit Generationen von Rattan, der Pflanze mit vielfaltigen Eigenschaften.

programme.title: GEO Reportage
programme.desc: Die Harpyie zahlt zu den imposantesten und kraftigsten Greifvogeln der Welt. Mit einer Flugelspannweite von bis zu zwei Metern jagt sie im dichten Blatterdach des sudamerikanischen Regenwaldes vorwiegend Affen und Faultiere. Bis heute sind die scheuen Tiere kaum erforscht. Wissenschaftler testen daher verschiedene Moglichkeiten, den Jagern des Dschungels auf die Spur zu kommen.

programme.title: Stadt Land Kunst Spezial
programme.desc: Jeden Samstagnachmittag entfuhrt Sie Linda Lorin ins Wochenende mit tollen Reisetipps, die von Freiheit und Romantik erzahlen. In dieser Folge: Jean-Christophe Rufin: Faszination Recife, Recife: Im Rhythmus des Frevo, Brasilien: Die Legende der "Fliegenden Wale“

programme.title: Stadt Land Kunst Spezial
programme.desc: (1): Alexander McCall Smith: Mma Ramotswe auf Safari in Botsuana (2): Botsuana: Konigliche Safari (3): Botsuana: Livingstone, der Missionar

programme.title: Zu Tisch
programme.desc: Das Ferghana Tal im Osten Usbekistans ist bekannt als Fruchte- und Gemuseparadies. Hier bewirtschaftet Bahriddin Yunusov seinen kleinen Garten und erntet im Herbst Quitten, Kaki und Kurbisse. Kurzlich gab es Familiennachwuchs bei den Yunusovs - zur Feier wird groSS aufgetischt: Es gibt die Nationalspeise Plov, die gefullten Teigtaschen Manti und eine kraftige Shurpa-Suppe.

programme.title: Unbekanntes Belize
programme.desc: "Unbekanntes Belize" ist ein Portrat uber die naturverbundene Mentalitat der Bewohner und Belizes Tierwelt und Landschaften. Die zweiteilige Dokumentation zeigt jene Frauen und Manner, die Belizes Ökosystem zu Land und im Meer schutzen. Diese Folge zeigt sowohl die Gefahren als auch die innovativen Losungen, die sich fur das Land abzeichnen.

programme.title: Unbekanntes Belize
programme.desc: "Unbekanntes Belize" ist ein Portrat uber die naturverbundene Mentalitat der Bewohner und Belizes Tierwelt und Landschaften. Gezeigt werden jene Frauen und Manner, die Belizes Ökosystem zu Land und im Meer schutzen. In dieser Folge treffen Promi-Koch Sean Kuylen und Journalistin Gillary Darabi Umweltschutzerinnen und Umweltschutzer, die sich fur bedrohte Tierarten einsetzen.

programme.title: Tierische Freibeuter der Meere
programme.desc: Faszinierende Naturspektakel und gewiefte Meeresrauber: „Tierische Freibeuter der Meere“ ladt zu einer Entdeckungsreise ein – von Patagonien uber Alaska und Norwegen bis nach Sudafrika. Bildgewaltig offenbart die Dokumentation, welche erstaunlichen Jagdstrategien Delfine, Wale, Orcas, Kaptolpel und Mowen entwickeln, um an ihre Beute zu kommen – und wie flexibel sie sich an die sich standig verandernden Meeresbiotope anpassen.

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: New York, am 15. Janner 2009: Kurz nach dem Start von Flug 1549 fallen die Triebwerke des Airbus A320 wegen Vogelschlags aus. Der erfahrene Pilot Chesley Sully Sullenberger entscheidet sich fur eine riskante Notlandung im Hudson River und rettet so allen 155 Menschen an Bord das Leben. Wahrend er als Held gefeiert wird, ermittelt die zustandige Behorde wegen menschlichen Versagens.

programme.title: Die Bienenflusterer
programme.desc: Die Dokureihe handelt von der einzigartigen Beziehung zwischen Menschen und Bienen. In dieser Folge: Die Zahl der Dunklen Biene geht kontinuierlich zuruck. Deshalb hat sich der passionierte Imker Stephane Liberi zum "Bienenhirten" ernannt und wandert von Tal zu Tal, um dieses wertvolle Kulturgut der Cevennen zu retten.

programme.title: Die Anden - Im Bann der Urkrafte
programme.desc: Der Geologe Colin Devey begibt sich auf eine Entdeckungsreise entlang der langsten Gebirgskette der Erde – geformt von Kraften aus dem Erdinneren und der Atmosphare. Er folgt Vulkanen, Erdbeben und tektonischem Druck, erlebt Gletscher, Wind, Wasser und Sonne als Bildhauer der Landschaft. Vom Chimborazo bis ins Amazonasbecken, von Patagonien bis zur Atacama-Wuste: Die Anden sind eine Region der Extreme.

programme.title: ARTE Reportage
programme.desc: (1): Tadschikistan: Der Staat ist das einzige muslimische Land auf der Welt, das heute einen strikten Laizismus praktiziert. (2): Uganda: In einem Slum in Kampala traumt ein Studioboss auch vom Ruhm, aber ganz anders als in Hollywood.

programme.title: Mit offenen Karten
programme.desc: Zwischen Silicon Valley und Peking tobt der Konkurrenzkampf um die kunstliche Intelligenz. Um sich die Vormachtstellung in der zukunftstrachtigen Branche zu sichern, investieren die US-amerikanischen und chinesischen Tech-Riesen gigantische Summen. Dabei geht es vor allem um generative KI-Modelle zur Erzeugung von Texten, Bildern und Musik. Diese technologische Revolution ist von strategischer Tragweite, wirft aber auch zahlreiche ethische Fragen auf.

programme.title: Umoja - Wo nur Frauen das Sagen haben
programme.desc: Mitten in einer der frauenfeindlichsten Gegenden der Welt, gibt es einen Ort, wo nur Frauen das Sagen haben: Umoja in Kenia. Die Frauen, die hier leben, stellen sich gemeinsam gegen das Patriarchat ihres Stammes: Bei den Samburu herrschen die Manner. Doch in Umoja haben sie keinen Zutritt.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: ARTE Journal, das europaische Nachrichtenmagazin, wirft einen aktuellen, weltoffenen und europaischen Blick auf Politik und Kultur.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Der Ägypter Mohammed Afifi betreibt einen Foodtruck in Astoria und hat grosse Plane: Er traumt von einer ganzen Flotte Imbisswagen und sogar von einem eigenen Restaurant. Um seinem Traum naher zu kommen, baut er bereits einen zweiten gebrauchten Truck mit seinem Bruder Ibrahim und einem kleinen Team aus. Sie arbeiten mit Hochdruck auf den Inspektionstermin hin, bei dem sie die Verkaufslizenz zu erhalten hoffen.

programme.title: Liebe und Krieg: Schwule Helden der Antike
programme.desc: Schwul und Soldat? Bei manchen schlagt die Fantasie bei diesem Thema Kapriolen. Bei anderen gibt es Diskussionen. Ein archaologischer Fund ruckt dieses Thema in den Fokus: die Kraft der Liebe soll eine Elite-Einheit aus 150 Mannerpaaren uber Jahrzehnte unbesiegbar gemacht haben, bis die Manner gemeinsam gegen Alexander starben. Liebe und Krieg – unvereinbar?

programme.title: Mein Kind ist trans* - was nun?
programme.desc: Kira kam als Junge zur Welt. „Ich bin ein Madchen“, eroffnete sie ihren Eltern im Alter von zwolf Jahren. Kiras Eltern stehen vor einem Dilemma: riskanten medizinischen MaSSnahmen zustimmen – oder abwarten? Was ist das Beste furs eigene Kind? So wie ihnen geht es vielen Eltern von Kindern und Jugendlichen, die sich im falschen Geschlecht fuhlen. Die Autorin Renate Werner begleitet drei Familien bei ihren schwierigen Entscheidungen und zeigt den Stand der Wissenschaft in der noch jungen Transforschung.

programme.title: I Am What I Am - Stolz, eine Frau zu sein
programme.desc: Als Efrat Tilma, eine der ersten in Israel, die ihre Transgender-Identitat offentlich gemacht hat, nach Jahren im Exil nach Hause zuruckkehrt, muss sie dort erleben, wie sich der Kreislauf der Diskriminierung, dem sie einst entkam, unter der Regierung von Benjamin Netanjahu wiederholt. Doch diesmal flieht sie nicht, sondern wird zur mutigen Vorkampferin gegen den gesellschaftlichen Ruckschritt.

programme.title: 42 - Die Antwort auf fast alles
programme.desc: Warum verlieben wir uns in diese oder jene Person? Warum wahlen wir die eine Partei und nicht die andere? Das ist – in liberalen Gesellschaften – doch unsere freie Entscheidung. Oder verkauft unser Gehirn sie uns nur als solche, und sie wurde tatsachlich von einer Art Autopilot getroffen? Mit anderen Worten: Ist unser freier Wille nur unsere eigene Illusion? Werden unsere Entscheidungen viel mehr von physikalischen oder neurologischen Gesetzen vorherbestimmt als uns bewusst ist?

programme.title: Kurzschluss
programme.desc: (1): Begegnung - Team Balkan, Baby (2): Balkan, Baby (3): Zoom: Bull’s Heart (4): Bull’s Heart (5): Challenges of a solitary mind

programme.title: Simply Red - Theâtre antique de Taormine
programme.desc: Avec une formation jazzy qui fait la part belle aux cuivres, Mick Hucknall, le leader de Simply Red, chante ses succès dans le decor magique de lamphitheâtre antique de Taormine.

programme.title: Jorja Smith And John Legend - Jazzopen Stuttgart 2022
programme.desc: À Stuttgart, la chanteuse britannique Jorja Smith et le pianiste et chanteur americain John Legend se succèdent sur la scène du celèbre festival Jazzopen.

programme.title: Un ete stupefiant
programme.desc: Deux adolescents et un homme handicape partent en road trip à travers le sud de l’Allemagne à bord d’un triporteur. Un voyage initiatique qui conte les amours hesitantes de personnages en quete d’eux-memes.

programme.title: Bresil, sur la piste des jaguars
programme.desc: Dans la savane du Cerrado, le biologiste Leandro Silveira et sa famille se rendent au Pantanal afin d’equiper de colliers GPS les jaguars evoluant sur le territoire. Les donnees recueillies doivent permettre d’en savoir plus sur leurs comportements. De retour à la ferme, Leandro construit un nouvel enclos avec piscine pour ses proteges.

programme.title: Le dessous des cartes
programme.desc: Les geants americains et chinois se disputent la suprematie dans le secteur de lintelligence artificielle, avec des investissements colossaux. LIA generative, qui produit textes, images et musiques, est au coeur de cette bataille. Cette revolution technologique soulève des enjeux strategiques et ethiques.

programme.title: Felix Vallotton, les couleurs du desir
programme.desc: Un siècle après sa disparition, lart de Felix Vallotton, peintre, graveur, dessinateur et ecrivain d’origine suisse, n’a rien perdu de sa puissance ambiguë. À travers la figure feminine, qui hante son oeuvre, ce documentaire tente de percer le mystère d’un artiste insaisissable.

programme.title: "La case de loncle Tom", du heros au traître
programme.desc: Immense best-seller en son temps, le roman "La case de l’oncle Tom" a porte la cause abolitionniste, tout en vehiculant des prejuges racistes sur les Afro-Americains. La formidable anatomie d’une oeuvre petrie d’ambivalences, qui a profondement marque les memoires.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Plusieurs fois par an, le Dr Jorge Fusaro prend la direction des hauts plateaux de la cordillère des Andes argentine où des familles qui vivent loin de toute infrastructure l’attendent avec impatience. L’isolement rend difficile la prise en charge medicale. Pourtant, ces personnes ont elles aussi besoin de soins reguliers.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Les habitants du Laos vivent depuis des generations du rotin, cette plante aux multiples proprietes.

programme.title: GEO Reportage
programme.desc: Au Perou, la foret amazonienne abrite l’un des plus grands rapaces au monde : la harpie feroce, menacee par la deforestation croissante. Pouvant atteindre deux mètres, dotee de serres aussi puissantes que les griffes d’un ours, la harpie feroce est un predateur redoutable pour les singes et les paresseux, ses cibles de predilection, qu’elle chasse à couvert, sous l’epais feuillage des arbres.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Trois reportages pour decouvrir la ville de Recife, au Bresil : la revelation de Jean-Christophe Rufin, le frevo fait danser le nord-est du pays, l’epopee des “baleines volantes”.

programme.title: Cuisines des terroirs
programme.desc: Comme de nombreux Ouzbeks, Bahriddin Yunusov cultive des fruits et legumes à côte de sa maison. En automne, les coings sont mûrs et Bahriddin les recolte avant les premières gelees. Il s’agit d’une variete particulièrement sucree que l’on peut manger fraichement cueillie et avec la peau.

programme.title: Le Belize
programme.desc: Situe à l’est du Guatemala, le Belize est un pays très implique dans la protection de sa faune et de sa flore. Bien que les dangers guettent les singes hurleurs ou les crocodiles, des solutions innovantes se profilent, à l’image de la culture des algues, grâce à des personnes engagees en faveur des espèces menacees. Un chef cuisinier et une journaliste vont à leur rencontre.

programme.title: Le Belize
programme.desc: Situe à l’est du Guatemala, le Belize abrite des ecosystèmes d’une grande richesse, du recif corallien aux lagons accueillant des lamantins, et aux montagnes mayas, habitat des jaguars. Conscient de ce patrimoine naturel, le pays est très implique dans la protection de sa faune et de sa flore. Sur le terrain, un chef cuisinier et une journaliste vont à la rencontre de personnes engagees en faveur despèces menacees.

programme.title: Les super-predateurs des mers
programme.desc: Une plongee dans les secrets de l’intelligence animale, à la decouverte des incroyables strategies de chasse deployees par les predateurs marins. Tourne en Argentine, dans la baie de Puerto Madryn, cet episode decrypte la technique d’echouage des orques, et revèle avec des images aeriennes comment, au sein du clan, elle se transmet aux jeunes, futurs chasseurs.

programme.title: Meduses
programme.desc: Les meduses sont-elles en passe de dominer les oceans ? Donnant la parole à l’une d’elles, ce documentaire aux images envoûtantes devoile les superpouvoirs de ces creatures d’apparence si fragile, qui profitent de la surpeche, de la pollution et du rechauffement climatique pour proliferer.

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: Ce 15 janvier 2009, lorsque le commandant Sullenberger, dit "Sully", decolle de laeroport LaGuardia de New York, avec son copilote Jeff Skiles, rien ne presage ce qui va se passer à bord du vol US Airways 1549, à destination de Charlotte, en Caroline du Nord… Deux minutes après le decollage, alors que lAirbus A320 survole le Bronx à plus de 850 mètres daltitude, des oiseaux heurtent les deux reacteurs. Limpact est aussi soudain que devastateur.

programme.title: Les beautes de la cordillère des Andes
programme.desc: Dans la cordillère des Andes, un geologue passionne etudie comment les mouvements des plaques tectoniques, les volcans, les glaciers, le vent, leau et le soleil sculptent les paysages de ces montagnes grandioses.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Decouverte du Botswana : les enquetes de Mma Ramotswe, le delta de l’Okavango, et lexplorateur David Livingstone.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Les food trucks sont omnipresents à New York, en particulier à Astoria, dans le Queens, un quartier qui symbolise plus que tout autre le creuset americain. Une telle diversite linguistique et culturelle nexiste nulle part ailleurs. Avec, à la cle, des specialites culinaires du monde entier.

programme.title: Umoja, le village sans hommes
programme.desc: Dans un petit village du nord du Kenya, une communaute de femmes rescapees de violences, apprennent à se reconstruire et vivre en autonomie.

programme.title: ARTE Reportage
programme.desc: Le Tadjikistan est l’unique pays musulman au monde à reprimer les signes de l’islam, pour une laïcite stricte / En Ouganda, dans un bidonville de Kampala, un studio de cinema reve dun destin glorieux à la Hollywood.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: 28 minutes samedi
programme.desc: Retour sur lactualite internationale : la liberation de Boualem Sansal et les relations franco-algeriennes ; laccord avec le Mercosur divise lUnion europeenne ; la retentissante affaire de corruption en Ukraine ; la BBC dans la tourmente suite à un montage juge trompeur d’un discours de Donald Trump.

programme.title: Le bataillon sacre de Thèbes : les autres 300
programme.desc: Dans la Grèce antique, un bataillon de combattants thebains, longtemps repute invincible, aurait selon certains auteurs ete constitue de cent cinquante couples dhommes. S’appuyant sur de recentes decouvertes archeologiques, ce documentaire retrace l’histoire d’une troupe d’elite qui pourrait bousculer notre vision de la guerre et de l’amour.

programme.title: Transition de genre, accompagner son enfant
programme.desc: Trois jeunes personnes entament une transition de genre, accompagnees par leurs familles respectives. Un documentaire d’une grande justesse, qui lève le voile sur le parcours complexe des personnes transgenres.

programme.title: I Am What I Am : fière detre une femme
programme.desc: Après plus de trente-cinq ans d’exil, la pionnière trans Efrat Tilma revient en Israël au milieu des annees 2000. Face à la menace que le gouvernement Netanyahou fait peser sur la communaute LGBTQIA+, elle s’engage aux côtes de jeunes militants pour un vibrant combat en faveur de l’egalite.

programme.title: Court-circuit
programme.desc: Trois courts metrages qui partagent le sentiment detre "assis entre deux chaises" : "Balkan, Baby" de Boris Gavrilovic, "Bull’s Heart" de Margarita Bagdasaryan et "Challenges of a Solitary Mind" dAstrid Rothaug.

programme.title: Le ressentiment
programme.desc: 1990, en Ukraine sovietique. Yasha, 17 ans, subit l’hostilite de sa directrice d’ecole et de ses voisins en raison de son identite juive. Malgre les conseils de son père, le jeune homme se laisse envahir par sa colère... Presente en première mondiale à la Berlinale 2024, ce court metrage poignant raconte la quete de liberte d’un adolescent.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Dans une societe democratique, les decisions sont reputees relever du libre arbitre. Mais est-ce toujours le cas ? Sachant que le cerveau se met parfois en mode "pilote automatique", la liberte de choix n’est peut-etre qu’une illusion. Et si nos choix etaient davantage dictes par des facteurs physiques ou neurologiques ?

programme.title: Les maîtres des abeilles
programme.desc: Au coeur des montagnes cevenoles vivent des colonies d’abeilles noires "Apis mellifera". Pour proteger les abeilles, aujourd’hui en danger de disparition, et preserver une tradition en desherence, Stephane Liberi, berger et apiculteur, a cree son rucher à 800 mètres d’altitude, en collectant une à une de vieilles ruches-troncs recuperees dans la region.

programme.title: Georgie, le port de tous les enjeux
programme.desc: L’arret de la construction d’un port d’envergure en Georgie temoigne des tensions qui animent le petit pays caucasien. Tourne en 2022, ce documentaire souligne combien le cap semble encore indecis entre viree à l’Est ou à l’Ouest.

programme.title: Un monde nouveau
programme.desc: Face à un avenir assombri par la crise climatique, le realisateur et militant ecologiste Cyril Dion parcourt le monde à la rencontre de personnes qui ont revolutionne une region, un pays ou une activite, et esquisse un nouveau recit : celui d’un monde plus juste et plus ecologique.

programme.title: Un monde nouveau
programme.desc: Face à la crise climatique, Cyril Dion part à la recherche d’un monde plus juste et plus ecologique. Dans ce volet, il rencontre le survivaliste John Ramey et le collapsologue Pablo Servigne. Il raconte aussi comment la ville du Cap, en Afrique du Sud, a mis en place des mesures drastiques de rationnement deau, et comment Cuba a cree de nombreuses fermes urbaines pour eviter la famine.

programme.title: Un monde nouveau
programme.desc: Aux quatre coins du monde, Cyril Dion decouvre de formidables initiatives pour regenerer les forets, les sols, les recifs coralliens, les modes de culture mais aussi les democraties et les systèmes educatifs.

programme.title: ARTE Junior, le mag
programme.desc: Pour les 10-14 ans, lactualite internationale et europeenne traitee à hauteur denfant, à partir de questions posees par des elèves du primaire français et allemand, de portraits denfants ou de reportages.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Galaxies, etoiles, planètes… L’Univers et tout ce qui le compose ont-ils toujours existe ? Ou bien un big bang a-t-il donne naissance à toutes les merveilles du monde observable ? Et, dans ce cas, qu’est-ce qui a declenche le boum originel ?

programme.title: 100 ans d’evolution de l’habitat
programme.desc: Il y a cent ans naissait l’architecture moderne, un nouveau modèle centre sur la lutte contre l’insalubrite et l’exiguïte de l’habitat. Dans cet episode : la salle de bain privee. Longtemps un luxe reserve aux plus riches, elle devient accessible aux classes populaires à partir de 1924 grâce aux cites ouvrières developpees par Le Corbusier en France ou par Bruno Taut en Allemagne.

programme.title: Twist
programme.desc: Chaotique, bruyant et froid, le monde actuel laisse peu de place à la chaleur humaine et au calme. Le "cocooning" entend pallier ce manque, comme une invitation à se replier sur soi pour s’accorder reconfort, securite et intimite. "Twist" part à la rencontre d’artistes qui explorent cette notion, chacun à leur manière.

programme.title: Au-delà des nuages : les Andes
programme.desc: Au cœur de la cordillère des Andes, l’Équateur deploie une grande richesse de traditions et de savoir-faire. Des festivites de la “Mama Negra” à Latacunga au tressage des chapeaux panamas à Cuenca, en passant par les rites des chagras, des gardiens de betail montes à cheval, à Machachi, ce voyage met en lumière un patrimoine varie et vivant, veritable ciment de l’identite equatorienne.

programme.title: Cuisines des terroirs
programme.desc: Situee en Mediterranee, à quelques encablures de la côte albanaise, Corfou est la plus septentrionale des îles Ioniennes. Ses hivers pluvieux en font l’une des plus vertes de Grèce. Alexandra et Nikos Guliumis se sont lances dans la culture de kumquats il y a dix ans, mais leur production n’est proposee que depuis peu sur les etals des marches et commerces de l’île.

programme.title: Les Trans-Europ-Express, des trains de legende
programme.desc: Symboles d’integration europeenne et modèles de confort : trente ans après leur disparition, les mythiques trains Trans-Europ-Express continuent de fasciner.

programme.title: Un billet de train pour la côte des fjords norvegiens
programme.desc: Sous le soleil de minuit, cap sur la magnifique ligne du Nordland, qui longe la côte norvegienne en traversant le cercle polaire, à bord de linsubmersible serie documentaire dARTE.

programme.title: Alerte aux ours en Transylvanie
programme.desc: En Transylvanie, les ours sont plus nombreux que nulle part ailleurs en Europe. Si ces grands predateurs à fourrure beneficient d’une certaine popularite dans l’imaginaire collectif, la cohabitation avec les humains n’en demeure pas moins compliquee dans la realite...

programme.title: Quand lhistoire fait dates
programme.desc: La banqueroute du système financier imagine par l’ecossais John Law pour liquider la dette colossale laissee par le règne de Louis XIV est le premier grand krach de l’histoire europeenne. Mais est-ce la faillite de la banque à billets qui fait date, ou ce qu’elle revèle du fonctionnement de la monarchie française en un moment crucial, celui de la Regence ? Avec lhistorien et economiste Arnaud Orain.

programme.title: Meurtres à Sandhamn
programme.desc: Une celèbre autrice de romans policiers est retrouvee morte à son domicile. Alors que Nora decouvre que sa propre famille est impliquee, le commissaire Forsman enquete, toujours en lutte contre son addiction.

programme.title: Antarctica, sur les traces de lempereur
programme.desc: Vincent Munier sur la banquise, et Laurent Ballesta dans locean, portent un nouveau regard sur lAntarctique.

programme.title: L’Arctique, une region bouleversee
programme.desc: Touche par le rechauffement climatique et la fonte des glaces, l’Arctique resiste encore. Sur les traces d’une ourse polaire, visite d’une region sauvage et menacee.

programme.title: Les maîtres des abeilles
programme.desc: En Argentine, la transhumance au fil de l’eau de centaines d’apiculteurs dans un veritable eden pour les abeilles...

programme.title: Les grands moments de la musique - Le documentaire - Martha Argerich et Daniel Barenboim à Buenos Aires
programme.desc: En 2014, Daniel Barenboim et Martha Argerich, ensemble au piano, creaient l’evenement au Teatro Colon de Buenos Aires avec des pièces de Mozart, Schubert, Schumann et Stravinski.

programme.title: Karambolage
programme.desc: Aya Kouame vit en Allemagne. Dans son contrat de location figure un long paragraphe dans lequel on lui explique quil faut qu’elle aère sa chambre : c’est le "StoSSluften", l’aeration par à-coups - Gros plan sur les couleurs du drapeau français.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: Henri Matisse, peindre de nouveaux horizons
programme.desc: Grand voyageur en quete de lumière, Henri Matisse a sillonne le monde, du Maroc à Tahiti, pour s’en inspirer, loin de tout pittoresque, dans une explosion de couleurs. Portrait de cet immense peintre, qui n’a cesse de se reinventer en conjuguant sensibilite et ouverture.

programme.title: Juge coupable
programme.desc: Frank Beechum, un jeune père de famille noir au passe de petit delinquant, est dans le couloir de la mort pour avoir tue une jeune caissière blanche qui lui devait de largent. Le jour de son execution, un article doit paraître sur lui et ses dernières heures de condamne dans le journal de la region. Steve Everett, un vieux journaliste passionne par les femmes et lalcool, couvre cet evenement.

programme.title: Clint Eastwood, la dernière legende
programme.desc: Du gentil cow-boy de ses debuts televises au mercenaire cynique des westerns de Sergio Leone, du flic tordu de Dirty Harry au photographe romantique de Sur la route de Madison, et jusquau vieil homme de ses derniers films, Clint Eastwood a incarne un eventail surprenant de personnages, tout en restant lui-meme. Son parcours est à son image : en mouvement, libre et riche de multiples facettes.

programme.title: Les pionniers de la musique de film
programme.desc: Un siècle de bandes originales de films "made in Hollywood", inspirees de l’heritage europeen, de Franz Waxman à Hans Zimmer, du classique au populaire.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Extended edition in which Stephen Fry takes charge of proceedings for the last time, asking Alan Davies, Chris Addison, Sara Cox and Sue Perkins questions about misconceptions

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Glen Powell, Colman Domingo, Rosamund Pike and Jack Whitehall join Graham on his sofa. Ed Sheeran also joins the conversation after performing Camera from his album Play.

programme.title: The Weakest Link Celebrity Specials
programme.desc: The celebrity contestants in this episode are Kate Lawler, Les Dennis, Troy Deeney, Jordan Gray, Jeff Brazier, Aljaz Skorjanec, Ella Thomas and Roo Irvine.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by coming up with the answers that no-one else can think of.

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: Home potters compete to become the new champion of British pottery. It is garden week, and the seven remaining potters must make stunning ceramics for the great outdoors.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks into Occupations and Offices with Deirdre OKane, Richard Osman, David Mitchell and Alan Davies.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Dyffryn Gardens near Cardiff, where treasures include a necklace made from some of the largest pieces of Baltic amber that jewellery specialist John Benjamin has ever seen. Jon Baddeley admires a humble compass once owned by local man Edgar Evans, who was part of Scotts ill-fated Antarctic expedition and one of the first of the party to lose his life on the ice

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks at over and ova. Learn some tricks you can do with eggs, meet a flying pig and join in as the studio audience sings along with western film themes. With Bill Bailey, Jan Ravens, Grayson Perry and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sally Phillips, Ross Noble and Nish Kumar join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an unconventional look at the theme Odorous and Odious.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig considers various odds and ends. Ever wondered how to tell a schnauzerorgan from a paddywhack? Sandi has the answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks at opposites. Find out how to sort the sheep from the goats, discover the opposite of Tarzan and meet the telescope that points straight through the Earth. With Sara Pascoe, Colin Lane, Jimmy Carr and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks at Operations. If youve ever wondered how to turn a muffin into an offensive weapon, this is the show for you. With Bill Bailey, Katherine Ryan, Rhod Gilbert and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended version of the quiz in which Jason Manford, Romesh Ranganathan and Holly Walsh join regular participant Alan Davies to vie for points awarded for interesting - if not always correct - answers. In a Christmas-themed edition, the panellists learn the best way to wrap an awkwardly shaped present and get wine stains out of a carpet.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks into some origins with Josh Widdicombe, Susan Calman, Rich Hall and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks at some objects. Along the way, discover where you can find an actual UFO and meet the worlds best-dressed crab. With Sarah Millican, Cariad Lloyd, Alice Levine and Alan Davies.

programme.title: Planet Earth III
programme.desc: Attenborough journeys into the forests where dogs communicate with whistles, treehoppers fight assassin bugs, spirit bears fish, and hornbills imprison themselves in trees.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Return to the Wild
programme.desc: Ben revisits his old friends Georg and Bettina, who live on a remote bogland in County Mayo. They found solace in the wilds of Ireland, but three years later, they are still weighing up options. 3/6

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Return to the Wild
programme.desc: Ben makes an unprecedented third visit to see his old friends Bill and Bob, elderly twins living in the canyons of Utah, and realises that their paranoia about the outside world has grown.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team are in the grounds of BBC Caversham near Reading. Items include a communion book originally owned by the poet Wilfred Owen and an Aston Martin first driven by an RAF group captain in World War II.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The team travel to the Lake District where Fiona Bruce and the experts meet hundreds of local visitors proudly bringing their family treasures for evaluation. Theres an eclectic mix of objects featured ranging from a writing desk from the tsars palace bought after the Russian Revolution, over 100 vintage fire helmets owned by a former firefighter, Edwardian weightlifting equipment still in use today by a 75-year-old owner, and a collection of glam rock stage costumes. Closing honours goes to a rare collection of signed first editions by Beatrix Potter still owned by descendants of the writers solicitor.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce introduces unscreened gems from recent shows. Experts investigate some fascinating finds, including a suitcase of unopened letters from an imprisoned soldier in World War I.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The eight remaining bakers work with pastry to create a very Danish breakfast, a classic British tart and a bite-size showstopper which is difficult to make but trickier to bake!

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The first-ever GBBO Botanical Week involves a signature challenge with a twist, a leafy technical challenge from Paul, and three tiers of elaborately decorated showstopper cake.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its Dessert Week! The bakers face a very sweet signature challenge, a tricky French dessert for the technical challenge, and a multi-bake mousse marathon of a mini-showstopper.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In...
programme.desc: Comedy goddess Dawn French joins Richard in Athens for some ancient history, doughnuts, molecular food, ouzo, and a radical pedicure involving a toothless fish.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In...
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by comedian Nish Kumar for a short break in Portugals second city, starting their trip with a welcome tipple of its eponymous fortified wine

programme.title: The Weakest Link Celebrity Specials
programme.desc: The celebrity contestants in this episode are Kate Lawler, Les Dennis, Troy Deeney, Jordan Gray, Jeff Brazier, Aljaz Skorjanec, Ella Thomas and Roo Irvine.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Glen Powell, Colman Domingo, Rosamund Pike and Jack Whitehall join Graham on his sofa. Ed Sheeran also joins the conversation after performing Camera from his album Play.

programme.title: Would I Lie To You?
programme.desc: Jack Carroll, Bridget Christie, Gabby Logan and Big Zuu join host Rob Brydon and team captains Lee Mack and David Mitchell to sort out the fact from the fiction. Each celebrity guest reveals extraordinary stories about themselves. Are they telling the truth, or are they making it all up?

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Emmanuel Sonubi welcomes Troy Hawke and Olga Koch to the stage.

programme.title: Scandinavia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: On the final leg of his Scandinavian journey, Simon uncovers the surprising and sometimes shocking side of Sweden and Denmark, two of the happiest and wealthiest countries on earth.

programme.title: Attenborough and the Jurassic Sea Monster
programme.desc: 150 million years ago, dinosaurs ruled the land, but the oceans were dominated by a mysterious sea monster. Meet the pliosaur, the Tyrannosaurus rex of the seas!

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: As daylight dwindles in the Alaskan wilderness, Life Below Zero turns its focus to the creatures that thrive in the darkness. This episode explores the challenges faced by Alaskans as they contend with the unseen threats that emerge under the cover of night.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig considers various odds and ends. Ever wondered how to tell a schnauzerorgan from a paddywhack? Sandi has the answers.

programme.title: QI

programme.title: Planet Earth III
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an extreme world, where animals battle to survive the elements - and life exists on a knife edge.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Return to the Wild
programme.desc: Ben makes an unprecedented third visit to see his old friends Bill and Bob, elderly twins living in the canyons of Utah, and realises that their paranoia about the outside world has grown.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Return to the Wild
programme.desc: Ben Fogle revisits Rauri on Rathlin Island, who left HR for off-grid life. They repaint Rauris house and discuss his health struggles, and a daring journey he made to help those in need.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: Ben heads to Slab City in the Californian desert to explore an alternative community.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: Ben journeys from Stroma, inhabited 1,000 years ago, to Swona, its first inhabitants being the Vikings and then to the towering prehistoric cliffs of St Kilda, the most remote of Scotlands islands.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: Ben visits the Caribbean island of Montserrat, where a volcano devasted large areas in the 1990s. Within two years most of the population had fled their homes. Ben uncovers unique stories of heroism and loss.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Bake Off presents its first Tudor Week! The signature is a Tudor classic, the technical challenge is a knotty biscuit, and the final challenge should spoil a wealthy Tudor banquet.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The semi-final sees the bakers tackling three patisserie-based challenges, including a French pastry, a yeast-based cake and a multiple mini-cake showstopper.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its the final, and three bakers remain. The theme is Royal Bake Off, with three challenges to impress the Queen, and the signature challenge returns to the dreaded meringues.

programme.title: Worlds Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Starting from one of the worlds most remote cities, Walvis Bay, in Namibia, we roll 1,500 miles through the Kalahari desert to Pretoria, South Africas Executive Capital.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Its the semi-final and in the way of a place in the final stand three utilitarian challenges; the trench coat, a garment from old cleaning products, and boiler suits made to fit their models perfectly.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games Night
programme.desc: Ed, Sian, Dara and Sindhu play Dont Cry For Me Guatemala, Its Not Me, Its You, Sounds Like and Get Your Head In The Game on the second evening of the competition.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The Wattersons look back on Anais first days in the Watterson house. Gumball and Darwin quickly find themselves up an opponent who is able to outsmart them at every turn.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Gumball and Darwin track a women emerging from their home they discover her to be a member of a gang of wise-cracking elderly friends. However as they get closer and closer to her life they realize they may know her already.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Darwin ends up in detention with the Bomb Kid who decides to make Darwin his new target. However it backfires when Darwin ruins his life.

programme.title: Totally Spies!

programme.title: The Heroic Quest of the Valiant Prince Ivandoe
programme.desc: Prince Ivandoe and Bert reluctantly agree to bring Princess Syllabob, of the Underwater Kingdom, an all-powerful Trident for her Sweet Sixteenth birthday. However, it is currently in the possession of Ivandoes great nemesis - Prince Svan - who has found another, less dignified, use for it. Ivandoe and Bert must risk all, entering the Swan Palace and avoiding the appalling Royal Family, in order to fulfill their promise to King Axalotyl, King of the Deep.

programme.title: The Heroic Quest of the Valiant Prince Ivandoe
programme.desc: Prince Ivandoe reluctantly accepts an invitation to a Royal MidSwanner Feast. "Reluctantly" because the invitation is from his nemesis, the awful Prince Svan of Svanland! As the feast progresses, it becomes increasingly clear that Prince Ivandoe, along with three rather peculiar guests, are the unwitting victims of a typically cruel Swan deception. Swans!!!!!!

programme.title: The Heroic Quest of the Valiant Prince Ivandoe
programme.desc: In an attempt to win the hand of Princess Jezabel, Boaris Von Tusk stages a tournament to prove that he is the greatest warrior in all The Five Kingdoms. Prince Ivandoe takes part, of course, for no warrior is greater than he! But so too does a Masked Knight who not only wins but turns out to be... Jezebel herself! For Jezebel is nobodys prize!!!

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Gumball and Darwins conversation dries up they worry that their friendship is coming to an end. They try to find ways to get the conversation flowing again but nothing seems to work. Maybe they have just grown apart?

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball, Darwin and Banana Joe investigate Banana Barbaras mysterious disappearance and uncover an old rivals shadowy scheme in the process.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball and Darwin panic when they suspect they’ve accidentally turned Miss Simian into a cushion, by wishing upon an enchanted key ring. Surely the only way to break the curse is a confession of true love from Principal Brown. Simple!

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball and Darwin follow Nicole to the Rainbow Factory for Bring your Kids to Work Day. They are expecting a magical place full of dreams and wonder but it turns out to be a little less magical than they’d hoped. Despite the fact nobody wants them there, they end up saving the factory from being closed down.

programme.title: The Wonderfully Weird World of Gumball
programme.desc: Richard must retrace the memories of his day in order to figure out what "the thing" is, so Nicoles family dinner with Granny Jo Jo wont be another epic failure.

programme.desc: Lamput takes refuge in a spooky castle on the hill. The Docs, hot on Lamputs heels, find an unattended broomstick, and, typically, their first instinct is to use it to try to squish their orange quarry. But they quickly discover the broomstick has other, way cooler, uses. Before long the Docs are engaged in some high-speed, unlicenced magical broomstick-riding. Luckily for Lamput, the castles owner steps in. Shes green and witchy, and pretty annoyed about being disturbed from her moonbaking. When the docs break her magical broom, she flies into full witch-mode. Everyone gets transformed into frogs. Which, for Lamput, is a normal day at the office.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy is bothered by an object stuck in between the sofa cushions: a big fur lemming puppet glove.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers the leftovers of a Halloween party in the rangers cabin, which was entirely redecorated for the occasion, with stupefaction. But if the curious ambiance perturbs Grizzy, the Lemmings are in seventh heaven and have a whale of a time jumping up and down inside a cooking pot full of marshmallows. Grizzy wants to get rid of it until he accidentally swallows a marshmallow and discovers the best flavor of his life.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.desc: Everyone seems to be going on holiday apart from Mr Bean, so he decides to recreate one at home!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

But who could possibly sleep soundly surrounded by Lemmings who want their fair share too?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy happens onto an old American India medallion bearing the symbol of the wind. He who wears it has the power to command air streams. programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A magic horn lands on the muzzle of a moose, endowing it with grace and the ability to fly. When Grizzy sees this strange creature, he dreams of taming it as a gift for she-bear while the Lemmings imagine themselves playing rodeo.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: While looking for the TV remote-control device Grizzy happens onto a box that can localize a bunch of keys thanks to its key ring which is equipped with a tracker.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella

programme.title: Interstellar Ella

programme.title: Interstellar Ella

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation. The Agenda: No nonsense talk; Challenging perceptions.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Approximately 51 percent of the U.S. population is made up of women, but on "Outnumbered" the female advantage jumps to a 4-1 ratio. The hourlong show features a rotating panel of four women and one man discussing the days headlines from various perspectives. In addition to the top news of the hour, the panelists discuss leading pop culture and relationship issues making headlines that day. Regular FNC and FBN contributors appearing on the show include Emmy-winning newscaster Harris Faulkner and Melissa Francis.

programme.title: Where Did It Come From?
programme.desc: Host Michael Guillen travels to China to explore the roots of modern agricultural genius. He studies how the ancient Chinese invented advanced farming technology long before the west would use anything like it.

programme.title: Unidentified: Inside Americas UFO Investigation
programme.desc: In 2018, The New York Times ran a front-page story on a secret government programme that studied UFOs and the threat of alien invasion. This programme ran from 2007 to 2012 and allegedly compiled a trove of evidence into a 600-page report.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Search For The Lost Giants
programme.desc: When the Vieira brothers head west to explore an island shrouded in mystery, they uncover compelling evidence of giants, but their investigation takes a dark turn.

programme.title: Clash Of The Gods
programme.desc: Explore iconic myths, from the legends who inspired them to their real-life relevance today, in Clash of the Gods. Featured myths and the people behind them include the Labyrinth of the Minotaur, Thor: God of Thunder, Beowulf and Medusa.

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: ‘Warriors’ delves deep into the warrior mindset: the rites of passage, the initiations and the rituals, which reveal what makes them rise above the rest of humankind to lead, to fight, and in some cases, to die.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: This time we go in search of evidence of the clashing Scottish clans embroiled in the civil war that raged across the British Isles in the 17th Century.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: ‘The Universe’ examines how we know what we do about space; Mars, black holes and even if there is anywhere else out there that can sustain human life. This is the story of the scientists and explorers who dared to venture into uncharted territory.

programme.desc: The team searches for Geronimos skull, which is said to have been stolen from the Apache warriors grave. Plus, investigating what became of Al Capones Cadillac.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chum gets a taste of a Julia Child cookbook, but will he find a recipe for success, or will he end up with egg on his face? Then, Rick kickflips for a vintage skateboard collection. Will he land his ollie, or is it all just a trick?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In the 21st century, UFOs have gone from fringe science to mainstream obsession. UFO hunters are using incredible technology, and UFOs are being openly investigated. Are we closer than ever to understanding the strange events happening in our skies?

programme.desc: Are the photos taken in 1951 proof that a woman in St. Petersburg, Florida spontaneously combusted? What is the brain-numbing noise plaguing Brooklyn residents? Tony Harris and his team of experts delve into these claims to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Might the United States military really have a secret space programme? And if so, are we preparing for a space-based war with other nations... or other species?

programme.desc: There are mysterious ancient stones shaped into perfect spheres. Many of them show clear evidence of being manmade and some completely defy explanation. Could the mystery of the stone spheres provide clues about humankinds alien past?

programme.desc: In the 21st century, UFOs have gone from fringe science to mainstream obsession. UFO hunters are using incredible technology, and UFOs are being openly investigated. Are we closer than ever to understanding the strange events happening in our skies?

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Are the photos taken in 1951 proof that a woman in St. Petersburg, Florida spontaneously combusted? What is the brain-numbing noise plaguing Brooklyn residents? Tony Harris and his team of experts delve into these claims to uncover the truth.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Could a prehistoric-looking creature washed ashore in Georgia be something new to local scientists? Is a death-defying experience for a toddler proof of guardian angels? And did a UFO spotted in Canada burn up in the atmosphere?

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike meets a kindred spirit at a defunct Wisconsin railroad town and uncovers vintage treasures. Meanwhile in Illinois, Robbie becomes obsessed with getting a one-of-a-kind DeLorean knockoff back on the road.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi get a small set of tiny tools. Barry gets to the auction late and partners up with a pinch bidder. Mark Balelo comes away with a large printer, but will that translate into a large profit?

programme.title: Curse of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: A new, subsurface investigation on Skinwalker Ranch leads to a baffling discovery near Homestead Two.

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: As new research identifies who may have been behind the Oak Island mystery, the Laginas and their team are stunned by what they find in the Money Pit area.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
