programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The cool Autumn breeze isn’t enough to deter Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse from going out to find what special experiences the day might bring. However, with the weather and wind constantly changing, it’s very hard for the friends continue playing any one game. Will the strange weather spoil their fun, or will it bring them a special experience after all?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Among the newly fallen Autumn leaves Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very peculiar little, hairy, green… ‘something’. Intrigued by what it might be Little Nutbrown Hare asks all his friends, but they all have different answers! It is certainly a very useful ‘something’, great for back scratching and games but it takes Little Grey Squirrel to solve the mystery.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: It’s snack time and everyone has a cookie. Timmy wants to share his cookie with his friends. Help Timmy cut the cookie and count.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Forgetful Mayor Fox has misplaced the giant key to the city that hes supposed to be presenting to a visiting astronaut. Huckle and his pals try to figure out where he set it down. They learn that Mayor Fox did one thing while touring a candy factory that required both his hands - stirring a huge pot of candy goo. Not far away they find a big chocolate-covered key./When Busytown residents are baffled by mysterious door knocking, Huckle and gang discover who it is.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy has just woken up and is looking for his sock breakfast, but it is under his toy box and he can’t reach, or move it… He needs to know how to move heavy things, and the best place to find out the answer is Okido! When he arrives Zoe and Felix are also trying to move a heavy box! They need to go to the recycling centre today. So they all go to Zam and Zim to find out the best way to do it. Zim, Zam and Zoom are sunbathing and enjoying Zam’s latest invention when the three arrive.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy walks into the bathroom and is horrified to find it clean! It’s not right for a Messy Monster at all. “Why do you have to clean things anyway?” He asks himself. And he goes to Okido to find out! When he arrives Felix and Zoe are at the top of their treehouse and there is a noisy racket going on! They don’t know what it could be so they skidoodle to go and have a look. When they arrive in the centre of Okido there are funny little things making lots of noise hurtling around the streets and sending the Okidinians into chaos!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The girls decide to each bake Berrykin Bloom the perfect cupcake, to be presented at a ceremony honoring him for his achievements in Berryculture. Their efforts get comically out of control as they begin competing with each other to create the biggest and best cupcake ever!

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry and the dinos discover that theres a new dinosaur in the house, and it belongs to Nana.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to sleep out in his new tent in the garden so that he can practice his scout skills.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari was talking to her mom on her phone as she walks down a lonely street lined with a lampposts. As she stops under a lamppost and the light begins to flicker, she slowly looks upwards to see a monster hanging from a lamppost. She skates away in fear, and remember her phone was there. She returns to the area and notice the so-called monster looks like a bat. Back in the garden, Leo is practicing with his jetpack maneuvering skill by performing spiral pattern and zig zag. He talks to Katie who is by her computer. After almost crashing into Hero the dog, Leo crash lands on the ground. Katie jokes on his skill before Leo receives a call from Zari. Zari informs them of the monster she met, which they later to learn it is a Greater Flying Fox. After agreeing to help Zari out, the Junior Rangers travels to her location. They meet up with Zari under the lamppost, where she show them of the animal. Hero tries barking at the animal but it ignores him. Katie has an idea and pulled her tablet to guide the flying fox away. Leo takes Katies tablet and fly with his jetpack to guide the Flying fox. As they were travelling, Katie notices Leos Jetpack is malfunctioning, causing Leo to have issues with flying and he crash land uncontrollably into a bush. They check up on him and Leo is okay.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: The whole island is celebrating Christmas and there are decorations everywhere, but it doesn’t look very Christmassy at the scrap yard. Percy starts to worry that Reg is missing out and he tries to find something to take to Reg to cheer him up. But the only thing Reg seems happy about is scrap. Percy discovers that Reg is celebrating Christmas his own way and has been making his own decorations from scrap.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day while repairing an embankment, Marion strikes something hard and insists it must be the mast of a Viking Ship. It looks like a water pipe to Thomas but Marion is adamant that it isn’t. But the next day Thomas notices flooding near the bank and then there is a landslip and Marion has to admit her mistake and help prevent an accident.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: After an expedition to the Jungle, Doctor Natureza finds out that a little monkey, Simmy, hid in her plane and followed her to Dragontown. Grisu has to help Natureza to bring the monkey back and reintroduce into the wild. But Simmy doesn’t seem to be in a rush to return to wildlife and, being quite cheeky and lively, it gives Grisu a hard time. Eventually, the little dragon finds out that the monkey needs to make peace with its brother Sammy, and after that the two apes return to their home in the Jungle together

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Olivia and Sandro are preparing orienteering training for the crew. David and Steffan are to meet them but have been called to another mission. But they can’t let Olivia and Steffan know as their walkie-talkie isn’t working. Grisu volunteers to deliver the message with Stella’s help and following the map Olivia has prepared. But they must get to the firefighters before the enter the cave at the end of the trail. Grisu and Stella have to work without a compass after Fume breaks it; but using traditional navigation methods and with an ingenious invention from Grisu when all seems lost, the manage to deliver their message just in time.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse go on a long trip with Big Nutbrown Hare to find some food he hid away during the warmer months. Little Nutbrown Hare plays with a stick along the way, which turns out to have many uses, one of which is helping them find the food and another is finding their way home again.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Brewster learns about camouflage when he repaints the lizard’s house.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Pico has found a medal but the cats have stolen it from him. To get it back, Rosie decides to challenge the thieves to a race! But when Pico decides to be the one to race, Scoutbadger tries to help him by cheating. Unfortunately, nothing goes as planned, and because of his cheating, the young wild boar gets lost. His friends have to go search for Pico, who eventually turns out tobe pretty cunning to get his medal back!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob takes Pilchard for her check-up, he discovers that the Vet Tilly is looking after a dog named Cooper... and he likes to chase cats. Vet Tilly panics as Mayor Madison is arriving that evening with her cat to be groomed. She doesn’t want Cooper to chase the Mayor’s cat! Bob suggests making a reception area that keeps cats and dogs separate and immediately the Vet commissions the build. Now working against the clock, Bob and the team have to complete the new reception area before the Mayor arrives. But on promising to keep the animals away from the building work, Leo accidentally lets Pilchard escape from her basket and doesn’t return to collect Cooper. Bob can’t continue his work until all the animals are out of the way.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is looking after Curtis’s garage while Leo takes him out for a birthday meal at Chef Tattie’s. However, the meal is a ruse, arranged so that Bob and his gang can secretly give Curtis’ workshop a makeover. Scoop is excited to be at the garage; he claims to have a great knowledge of mechanics. The build is all on schedule until Bob is forced to attend to Mr Bentley who keeps him busy because he’s very fussy about how much air he has in Philip’s tyres. At the restaurant Curtis is keen to get back to the garage as he is nervous about leaving it in somebody else’s hands. When Bob rings Leo and asks him to play for time Leo orders more and more food for himself to eat. At the, now busy, garage Scoop decides to take a look at what’s troubling Betsy, using the new vehicle inspection lift.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle, Lowly and Sally find a lost bag, they use the eyeglass case, atomizer, map, and a red scarf inside it to determine that the owner is a famous international opera star who’s come to Busytown to perform for the first time./Cyclists getting flat tires somewhere in Busytown lead Huckle and the gang on a mystery.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this adventure, Kyle discovers a vibrant Peacock Spider in the Southern Australian Forest, fascinated by its cute and colorful appearance. Curiosity piqued, he calls the Junior Rangers, interrupting their game of musical statues. Concerned about the spiders potential venom, they consult their computer for information, learning about the spiders unique features and the dance it uses for courtship. Suddenly, a female brown spider interrupts the males dance and gets aggressive to which Leo, Katie and Hero fly off to Kyle to assist him. As they arrive, the brown spider continues to chase the colorful spider which leads to chaos as the spider jumps around, onto everyone, especially Kyle. The spider eventually seeks refuge on Kyle’s hat. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky, who calls Ranger Joey to give them insights on the spiders mating dance. With newfound understanding, they assist the male spider with its dance by dancing with it together and dressing up Kyle in colorful leaves to get its attention. With everyone dancing, including Hero, the male spider finally dances again and successfully impresses the female as they crawl away together. Back at the Treehouse, Leo, Katie, and Hero continue their game of musical chairs.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the wetlands of China, Kais drone, the Kaimera-1000, captures stunning footage of Red-Crowned Cranes before abruptly crashing into a crane’s nest. Faced with the challenge of retrieving the drone without disturbing the nesting crane, Leo, Katie, and Hero embark on a mission. They go on a search to find the drone via air but when they do find it, a crane sits on its nest - with the drone in it! They attempt to distract the crane using recorded calls of the crane but fail until a curious crane chick responds. Hero befriends the chick, triggering a joyful dance among the cranes. Hero howls, followed by the chick peeping, which causes the nesting crane to come and check on its baby. This allows Kai to recover his drone discreetly from the nest. Back at the treehouse, Leo questions why Hero is still howling and declares it a mystery but then his question is answered when a pair of cranes flies by.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: At the beach, Simon finds a pretty shell and wants to take it home as a souvenir. But when Grandma tells him that it’s actually a hermit crab and his home is inside it, he and Gaspard decide to put the little creature back at the edge of the water. But they hadn’t counted on Leon, a little boy who is on the beach, absolutely wanting the shell for his collection. Ah, but Simon is clever and he has plan for saving our little hermit crab!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar and Stanley are building a raft that gets carried away by the stream. They end up far from home, but then decide to head back during a storm. Christopher, the canary helps them, but they fall off during a gust of wind. They find refuge in a hollow to rest where they are finally discovered and helped to go home by the Spider. The next day, they play along the stream again, but they no longer worry if the raft run away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, tries to bake an apple pie, but unfortunately, it doesnt turn out well. With the help of a fairy, she manages to fix it and then finds a lost marker and repairs the window as well. The Lily Fairy discovers that Flutter solved everything on her own and then moves on to help others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, invites Bubble, Berry, and Dolly for a visit. They make ice cream and play together. Bubble admits to cheating in the game. Because of this, the little friends come up with a new game where everyone can win."

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest gather on the hilltop to watch the evening meteor shower. Stanley and Balthazar want to build a seesaw but constantly encounter obstacles. The Firefly helps them, and with the assistance of the Moon, they swing on the Moon rocker seesaw. The meteor shower mesmerizes them, then they bid farewell to each other, and everyone starts heading home. The Firefly falls asleep contentedly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is sad when his new orange balloon pops so Flop helps him make a Bye Bye Box, a memory box for broken toys too special to throw away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando play on the swings together but when Pando takes longer than his turn, Bing gets angry and runs infront of the swings and gets bumped.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is building a tower of blocks when Coco takes some to make a rainbow. When Charlie wants to play with the blocks too, they decide to make a new game they can all play.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If youre very quiet and statue still, then the duckies will come. Today, Bing and Sula are at the park to feed the ducks. Sula is very good at standing still like a statue and only giving a small handful of food to the ducks when they come up to her. Bing, on the other hand, throws all the food into the water at once – not thinking that a big quacking goose will come along and eat it all in one bite!

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One day, a mouse called Ferdinand Pearstalk turns up on Tildas doorstep and announces that he will be taking over her house: the vicar has swapped churches and with him the church mouse. To Tildas amazement, he immediately moves in. With a heavy heart, Tilda puts all her stuff on a handcart and trundles off.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert teaches the kids how to find one’s way through the forest. But as they search their way home, Rupert falls asleep. The kids follow their tracks and also help Rupert find his way back.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Mole Max thinks his son Karl is too young to go camping with the other kids. Tilda changes Max’s mind and Karl happily joins the trip. He feels insecure until he helps Tilda in an emergency.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse are surprised to find an egg lying on the ground. Blue Bird agrees to look after it and when a rather odd and demanding bird hatches, she loves it like her own. When Little White Owl hears it calling one night, she tells them all that the ‘lucky chick’ is a baby owl and she will teach her all an owl needs to know.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse go on an adventurous journey through the woods in search of a special Autumn leaf. They leave a trail of acorns to find their way home, but Little Grey Squirrel unwittingly collects the acorns and leaves them all lost in the woods. Luckily he is able to help when he climbs to the treetops and spies the meadow in the distance.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Spring is coming and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are very brave and go on a journey through the meadow to discover the source of a mysterious – and slightly spooky - creaking sound. They follow the clues to discover… it’s the frozen lake melting, and singing as it does!

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Whilst playing soccer in the park, Simon and Gaspard discover a skateboard. Gaspard wants to try it, but Simon gets first go, he saw it first!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: While playing in the garden, Leo and Hero stumble upon a reticulated python and its eggs. The Junior Rangers drive to the rainforest to find a suitable home for the python, but an aggressive hippo makes the task a lot more difficult.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Katie identifies a large-beaked bird in the garden as an Australian pelican. The Junior Rangers bring the pelican to a lake and track down the pelican’s parents.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson is trying for his Fire Warden badge and is thrilled to be given his own siren. When the fire alarm goes off, he must sound his siren and make sure everybody leaves the area safely. Wilson gets a little carried away practising and doesn’t hear when the real alarm goes off. He is given another chance and this time concentrates and takes his responsibilities very seriously. When the alarm goes off during the night, he is able to evacuate the chuggers from the roundhouses quickly and calmly.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson is flown to a secret location by Action Chugger and has to navigate his way home, using Dr. Ling’s new invention – the Chugnav. When a squirrel accidentally knocks the Chugnav upside down and back to front, causing it to malfunction, Wilson gets hopelessly lost. But once he figures out that he should do the opposite of what the Chugnav tells him, he gets back safely and earns his badge!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi spots a baby rabbit at the edge of the garden. Taking pity on this lone animal, he decides he wants to keep it. So he introduces it to Plume and Plumeau, hoping they’ll all play together. But despite his good intentions, T’choupi realizes before long that you can’t just invite any random guest into your home…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina and Dad have fun imitating birdsongs and are very good at it. Tchoupi, however, is totally unable to join in: singing like a bird isn’t his forte! Frustrated, he suggests they play hide And seek in the forest instead. Nina’s fine with it… as long as they do a "special kind of hide And seek," using birdsongs to find each other! T’choupi opts for the simplest song of all: a cuckoo, with its characteristic "kookoo" greeting: Kookoo, kookoo!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This lunchtime, T’choupi refuses to eat the fish Dad has cooked, supposedly because it doesn’t look tasty. But Mom insists: T’choupi can’t say he doesn’t like it if he hasn’t even tried it! So, when his parents aren’t looking, T’choupi slips his piece of fish to Ciboulette the cat, who just happens to be passing by at that moment. There we are – no-one’s any the wiser, mumbles T’choupi with a sigh of relief. But when, a short time later, he notices poor little Ciboulette has a strange cough, he gets worried: did the fish he gave her to eat give her a stomach ache??!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Today, its duck fishing with Mehdi! But as the host sets up his activity, Ben realises that he hasnt got any snacks. Charley and his friends want to share theirs with him, but Ben has another idea. With Paulie, he steals a fishing rod and... its off to fish... for snacks!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: For the Great Neighborhood feast, each resident brings a square that best represents him or her, and that will join the big patchwork of the year. Sam help Julia to make her own square in time.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia got bored. GrandMa lend them a long knitting needle that is supposed to indicate them the direction of great things to do. It seems it works, but is the needle really a magical one?

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Phillip, the little diesel boxcab, arrives at Knapford full of energy and enthusiasm. When Gordon tells Phillip how fast he is, Phillip is determined to prove that he is faster and challenges him to a race. Unfortunately Gordon is resting on the siding when Phillip comes over and when the express engine tells Phillip to “go away”, he thinks it’s a challenge and races off. When he gets to the other end of the line and Gordon still hasn’t overtaken him, Phillip assumes he’s won, causing Gordon to show him just how fast he really can be. Phillip is very impressed, but he is not in the least disheartened as he believes he still beat Gordon the first time.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Philip shows off to James about how many trucks he can pull, James decides to prove that he is the stronger engine by pulling a very long train. Soon disaster strikes as James can’t control all of the trucks and comes off the rails breaking through the side of a stone bridge. Philip races to save James and the brave little engine slips under James to rescue his new friend from falling and props him up until help arrives.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: After seeing him help Rosie with her toy, Mommy refers to Caillou as a "Kindness Superhero" which sends his imagination into overdrive. For the rest of the day "Super Caillou" and his sidekick "Super Gilbert" save an imaginary beach from Sharks and sunburn, whilst also making everyone in the real worlds day in the garden a little nicer, too.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his scout troop have been challenged to receive theirkindness badge this week! To do so, they must be kind to someone intheir community, look for acts of kindness in their lives, and, mostimportantly, be kind to themselves. Caillou is determined to finish histasks before Clementine!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Baby Sadies dolly has mysteriously gone missing somewhere between home and the band shell in Busytown Park. Huckle and his team search for clues at all the places Sadie visited that day. programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Gorilla shows Monkey and the children how to squat down with clenched fists, walk on four using their fists and beat their chest while crying out like a Gorilla’s.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah puts on a captivating lunchtime theatre show outside the Wholefish Cafe. Its so good that Charlie doesnt notice his stove burst into flames

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor leads The Pontypandy Pioneers on a dig to get their Dinosaur Badges. Peter finds what looks like a dinosaur fossil, but Nipper the dog snatches the bone and runs off, only to get stuck on a ledge over the edge of a cliff!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends

programme.desc: Loudo invites Scoutbadger, Rosie and Woodsy to a party. It makes Woodsy so happy that, out of joy, he jumps on a pile of wood and hurts his foot. The same stands for Scoutbadger whomust stay with his brother to help him out, as he cannot move.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky would like to organize a football tournament but he does not know how to do it... Doodleboo surely has an idea of Riddleboo to help him.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is looking for the perfect gift for Mothers Day! He can count on Doodleboo to have a good idea...

programme.desc: Sketcky dreams of going to the shooting stars night. But there will be a lot of people and Sketcky wants to get the best spot. Doodleboo knows exactly what he would need to arrive first tonight...

programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave build a playhouse for Little Lamb, Baby Calf and Littlest Bunny. First they choose a safe place to build. programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.desc: Kate and her stuffed toy friends use their imaginations to go on wild and incredible adventures.

programme.desc: T’choupi and Luce are awe - struck when they find out that Ciboulette the cat has just had kittens! programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Inspired by Nina and her father, who are preparing a delicious dessert with yummy blackberries from the woods, Tchoupi wants to make his own recipe from a forest ingredient. Easier said than done: chestnuts or mushrooms aren’t always easy to find… especially when there’s a greedy squirrel roaming nearby!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has a toothache. His daddy goes to get Dr. Bobola, but Dan, his older brother, thinks the doctor is going to pull his tooth! To avoid this, Julia tries to takes care of Sam instead of the doctor.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. programme.title: Tilda Appleseed

After the game, the two pairs of spectacles get mixed up and Emily and Rupert suddenly start suffering all manner of mishap: Rupert bites into an onion instead of an apple...

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Despite all Mommies’ effort to fix it, there is nothing to do, the door of the Triplet’s closet is definitely broken. It opens automatically every time someone closes it and it makes an awful shrilling noise. Instantly, the Triplet’s imagination goes wild, all the more that they just read a book about a knight ghost who haunts a dirty old castle. For them there is not doubt, their closet is haunted! What reassures not at all Poet, or Toto!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: "Tomorrow is my birthday", claims Girl, but Poet and Turbulent disagree: "No, mine!" they both answer. Mom explains that Triplets have the same birthday. The Triplets are quite disappointed, they each wanted to have their own party and their very own cake. However, Grandpa has an idea: he takes them to the countryside and shows Girl a rose bush which he created especially for her, lends a little plane to Turbulent, as well as a spyglass to Poet. At first, they are each extremely happy...but it is a lot more fun to share your presents, right?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As the Foxes leave to celebrate the summer solstice holiday at the Fox grandparents, Edmund sets about making a gift for Margaret. Indeed, this traditional holiday is all about giving gifts to those you love. The Twins are keen to make a present for Rosie. Thats great, but what should they do? Scoutbadger isthinking of something useful, while Woodsy leans towards something beautiful.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: When Caillou goes first for Show And Tell and needs to use the "How Am I Feeling" Board to express his emotions, its confusing at first, but as he recounts the story of his Grandmas birthday, he finds that no matter how you feel, you can always choose kindness.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When some of the engines think life would be easier without Diesel, he decides to teach them a lesson by hiding. But his plan backfires when none of the engines come looking for him! Diesel is painted with glow-in-the-dark paint and he plays a trick on the other engines... but Nia and Paxton surprise him in return!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Koko is yearning for adventure - and she just might get it, as today the chuggers are making deliveries out of town. But Vee asks Old Puffer Pete to accompany them - and he’s so SLOW. Pete tells them it leads to Old Chuggington, which is now a ghost town.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Eddie is always late so the Chuggers decide to find him a home in Chuggington, nearer to his workplace.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave create new patterns for Hatty’s hat. They try a stick-shaped pattern and a colourful fruit pattern, but Hatty’s perfect pattern, just has to be stripes!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi and Nina come across a waddling hedgehog while they’re playing in the vegetable garden. When their moms explain how beneficial these cute little creatures are to gardens, the two friends decide to do everything they can to make the hedgehog feel at home among the vegetables… Until the little animal… disappears!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah, navigating the scorching Thar Desert, finds Hardwickes Spiny-Tailed Lizards seemingly braving the intense heat. Concerned for their well-being, she contacts Leo and Katie who are in the garden about to commence in a water gun chase but are interrupted when Hero steals the water gun. Upon consulting the computer, they learn that the lizards need sunlight to regulate their body temperature. During the call, a falcon appears and scares the lizards back into their burrows! Leo, Katie and Hero fly to the desert to help the lizards find a way to stay in the sun without being harmed by the falcon. Attempting to aid them, they construct a tent, only for it to crash to their disappointment. They meet with Ranger Rocky who seeks advice from Ranger Joey, they discover the importance of sunlight for these cold-blooded creatures. A lizard approaches the rangers, trusting them enough to be around them when suddenly the falcon swoops in towards it! Hero intervenes to protect the lizard from the falcon and it flies off. With Ranger Rockys assistance, they come up with a new plan to keep the falcon away instead of protecting the lizards. With CDs hung on a tree, it reflects light which scares the falcon. The lizards can now safely bask in the sun, marking the success of the mission. In the Treehouse, a water gun fight ensues between Leo and Katie.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Dolly leaves for and adventure with Harry Hedgehog, so she asks Bubbles to take care of her flowers while shes gone. Bubble forgets to water them, so they quickly wither. Now Bubble has to find a way to make the flowers bloom again.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe

He travels through mystical lands and meets magical characters, and eventually discovers that the cure for boredom is his own imagination.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Kevin is very excited by the snow, but Victor doesn’t like it at all. He explains to Kevin that the snow is causing all sorts of trouble. Emily is stuck in the Steamworks, because the parts she is waiting for are on a truck that’s stuck in the snow at the depot. When Kevin goes outside some snow falls off the roof trapping him too. Victor thinks Kevin’s gone to try to fetch the truck from the depot and sets off to rescue his friend. Luckily Thomas has been sent to the depot too and is able to find Victor before anyone else gets stuck in the snow!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A young California Sea Lion makes a surprise appearance during Leo’s basketball game. Later, a voyage to find the sea lion’s home turns into a daring rescue on the high seas.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers have a brush with a poacher as they try to return an Indian Star Tortoise to its home in the scrub forest.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A swim in the garden brings Leo and Hero up close and personal with a Malayan water monitor. The Junior Rangers set out to search for the monitor’s home, but will their jeep survive a river crossing after a jeep float gets punctured?

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat must deliver the first prize in a treasure hunt but cant remember its location.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat must deliver a wind generator to Ted Glen, but strong winds make the job difficult.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere. Amma comes to the rescue with a giant warm bath and a giant carroty bagel.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop teaches Bing and Pando how to blow bubbles. Bing finally blows a big bubble but gets upset when Pando pops it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula head off for a picnic at the paddling pool with Flop. But when they get there, they are shocked to find there is no water inside. Bing’s disappointment soon gives way to the realisation that it’s a very special pool day. With no water there are all sorts of games they can play that are usually against the pool rules.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: During Bing’s bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and it’s too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald takes over the ice cream route when Johnny Snowman has the sniffles. Johnny is very grateful, especially as he has a special delivery that he does every Friday afternoon. Oswald and Weenie set off but soon find that doing a job isn’t always easy. Nevertheless, Oswald and Weenie press on and end up not only making that special delivery but also selling all of the ice cream!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie offer to pick tutti-fruits for Madame Butterfly so that she can make their favourite pie. They take little Catrina along with strict instructions not to let her spoil her appetite by eating the fruits. Once at the park, Catrina spots a mother bird struggling to feed her hungry babies and decides to help. Oswald doesn’t realise what she’s up to as he keeps being distracted by his passing friends. Thinking Catrina is trying to eat the tutti fruits herself, Oswald spills all of his fruits trying to stop her. But when he finds out what Catrina is really up to he gladly lends a hand.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Keen on Bob’s sardine sandwiches, Pilchard sneaks into his rucksack and hitches a ride to work at Chef Tattie’s UFO-themed revolving restaurant where she sneaks out and walks through some paint leaving a trail of green footprints. Inspired by all the talk of ‘aliens’, the Machines follow the trail. Pilchard arrives in the kitchen and goes to sleep on top of a remote control causing the restaurant to revolve at high speed. Bob saves the day by luring Pilchard off the remote control with a sardine sandwich. The team finish the restaurant and the Machines discover the truth about the ‘alien’ .

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team will be building an enclosure and viewing platform for the new giraffe. Lofty is excited that he will be seeing his favourite animal. But when the giraffe arrives he gets so anxious to get a good view that he crashes through a fence and frightens the giraffe away! Luckily he knows exactly what giraffes eat and is soon tempting the giraffe back to his enclosure with a big pile of leaves on his jib. The enclosure is finished and tidied up just in time and Bob suggests Jenny Dobbs names the giraffe after it’s biggest fan… Lofty!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One bright moonlit Autumn night, the Nutbrown Hares are both having trouble sleeping. As they lay quietly in a pile of leaves they listen to the sounds of the night… swish, hoot, wobble, nibble, croak and splash! They go on a journey to discover what’s making the interesting night noises, but will they work out what sound the moon makes?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Chilly Autumn winds blow as Little Nutbrown Hare chases the beautiful fallen leaves. When one wafts so high that only a bird could catch it Little Nutbrown Hare wishes he could fly as well. He and Little Field Mouse try every way they can think of to fly, without luck. They have fun trying, however, and along the way they discover they have their own very special talents.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Crisp Autumn days are perfect for collecting pretty golden leaves and playing hide and boo. Little Nutbrown Hare is so excited that he accidently promises to play with two different games with two different friends on the same day. He can’t be in two places at once, so how will he keep both his promises and both his friends happy?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class are having a boat race and all the boats have a different sail. What colour are the sails?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Red spots suddenly begin appearing on everything in Busytown from Mr. Rabbit’s mail box to Hilda Hippo’s roof! Huckle ultimately discovers that the red spots are really juice marks made from cherries falling from overhanging trees. / A teeny weeny piano motivates Huckle, Sally and Lowly to try to figure out who would own such a small instrument.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy finds a magnifying glass in his bedroom and everything looks bigger! He wonders why that happens so he goes off to Okido to find out. Messy lands in Felix and Zoe’s garden and they invite him to come exploring in the forest with them and Tweedy, the famous Explorer. She was the first person ever to see the very rare speckled-freckled frog! Zim and Zam arrive playing hide and seek with Zoom, but he is in disguise as a bucket, so they don’t seen him. Messy looks through Zam’s binoculars and asks how they work.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: OKIDO is a kindergarten series about a curious blue monster called Messy. When Messy has a question, he goes to OKIDO, a town where his human friends Zoe and Felix live. Together they get help with the answers from scientific experts Zim, Zam and Zoom. The questions range from the origin of moon rocks to why humans are losing their voicesIn the real world Messy is cold and wonders if it’s going to snow! And he shoots off to Okido to discover where snow comes from. In Okido, it’s the middle of summer and Felix and Zoe are about to go to the beach, when a storm blows overhead and a snowflake lands on Messy’s nose! They realise that it really is snowing and soon the whole place is covered in deep, white snow! The trio are building a snowman when the Cloudship arrives and Zim, Zam and Zoom tell them that the snow is causing problems all over Okido… “If it doesn’t stop snowing, we’ll never go to the beach!” says Felix.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Raspberry and Lemon want to join a fashion contest. They offer Strawberry to be their model, but she is too busy running both her cafe and the market. Raspberry and Lemon meet the twins Sweet and Sour Grapes, whose names fit their personalities and offer them to replace Strawberry in the cafe.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry and the dinos are playing a game of I Spy, Harry decides to spy his dinos, but he cant remember their proper dinosaur names.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry and Charlie are arguing over what the moon is made of. In order to settle their dispute they take a rocket journey to the moon via Dino World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah was driving her dirt bike but she stops as she hears a loud cries, grabbing her attention. She investigate and finds a baby moon bear crying for help. Back in the garden, Katie and Leo are playing tag. Leo blocks Katies path to touch Hero but Katie manages to tricks him. But Hero manages to escape as he was distracted by a butterfly. Suddenly, Farah calls for help through Leos watch, informing them of the poor animal cub with her. After the Junior Rangers learn that its a Moon Bear cub and wanting to help, they travel to meet up with Farah by riding PlatypusOne. Once theyre there, Farah tells them she has name the cub Cubby. Katie then reads her tablet and says that moon bear need to learn how to climb trees, swim, mark territories and communicate with other bears to survive, hence a montage happens of the Junior Rangers. Then they try teaching Cubby how to growl like a bear so they all imitate bear growling. Cubby gives it a try but struggle to do it. Ranger Rocky randomly appears and the Junior Rangers tells him of their situation. Ranger Rocky decides to call out his dear friend Ranger Joey and asks for help.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Percy misses his friend Gator and keeps thinking back to the times they had together. It’s making him sad, so the other engines advise him to keep himself busy to take his mind off it. So Percy rushes about trying to keep busy, and ends up losing control of some trucks which roll into an old mine. Percy is frightened to go in after them, until he remembers Gator again and what Gator taught him about being brave!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: There is a coal shortage at the Clay Pits. Timothy warns Bill and Ben to go easy and spare their coal. But Bill and Ben don’t listen, teasing each other, and Timothy and messing about, until they do run out of coal! Luckily Timothy runs on oil, so he manages to keep going, delivering clay to the docks and bringing back coal for the tank engine twins.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: It’s circus day in Dragontown! But when Grisu comes to ask for a fightfighting job, he discovers the circus performers are not there yet to put up the big tent for the circus. So Grisu volunteers, along with Stella’s help. But it’s not easy! The sheep almost eat the directions, and the poles are heavy, and Fume gets in the way. In the meantime, Stranavoce travels across town to announce the circus, coming across the strange talents of some Dragontown residents. Just as Grisu and Stella have finished planting the poles and are ready to raise the tent, Stranavoce gets a call: Now the circus performers aren’t coming at all! Oh no!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Ratatino was supposed to be filming the very shy Leopard Monkeys for his new documentary in the jungle. But he fell at the airport and hurt his arm, so he asks Grisu to go in his place, to track and film the monkeys for him. Fume is happy to fly Grisu to the jungle as he hopes it will give him a chance to do some dragon training with his son. However, tracking the Monkey’s proves to be a very difficult task until Grisu discovers they like music and he turns Fume into a one-man jungle band as he films the Monkeys successfully.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is very proud of a Christmas Tree he has built from pine cones. So proud, that when Little Field Mouse accidentally knocks it over he has trouble forgiving her. When he makes a mistake of his own, Big Nutbrown Hare forgives him immediately, and he understands how important it is to forgive.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Seeing his tracks in the fresh snow inspires Little Nutbrown Hare to create a new game called ‘snow seek’. The friends have a lot of fun creating tracks for Little Nutbrown Hare to follow, but Little Redwood Fox’s tracks completely disappear and so does she. When Big Nutbrown Hare reports that Little Redwood Fox was sighted walking backwards, they work out how she managed to trick them all.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Margaret is happy and proud to show to her whole family the clay vase, which she just finished. Wisely, she makes the children promise not to touch it, to let it out to dry. All agree and they go fetch water and flowers to fill in the vase… When they return, Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy find the vase broken! Rosie accuses Woodsy: he’s the only one who came back to the burrow during their errand! Cornered, Woodsybroods but soon gets help from Loudo.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are building Spring City’s new Ice Rink when the Rockets arrive and plead with him to finish it as soon as possible. They explain that the rink they were going to be playing on that evening is out of action and they have no-where to play! Bob tells them he’ll do his best and the building begins. Muck is fascinated by the idea of Ice Hockey and when Bob and Wendy set off to get the clear plastic panels to fit in the barrier surrounds, Muck decides to have a little go himself. Despite Leo’s protestations, all the machines are soon skidding about on the ice causing mayhem! When Bob and Wendy arrive back, they are alarmed to see all the barriers knocked down! Muck says sorry but Bob knows that the Rockets will be back very soon and they need to work fast.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are finishing off the new extension to the Spring City Museum. They are awaiting the delivery of its first exhibit – a full sized Tyrannosaurus Rex skeleton. Mr. Bentley has come out in his lunch break to supervise the arrival of the skeleton. But while Bob is back at his yard Leo discovers to his horror that Mr. Bentley has bungled the dimensions of the doors to the new extension, and now they are unable to get the huge dinosaur skeleton inside. Lofty suggests taking the skeleton to pieces and reassembling the bones inside the building.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and the gang race all over Busytown trying to find the lock that fits and old key they found. They search everywhere from the Busytown Museum to Mr Gronkle’s antiques. They come up empty until they remember that an old roll top desk was being delivered to the antique store near where they found the key and had a lock on it. They try the key and it fits. / Chocolate sauce on Lowlys car leaves Huckle and the gang puzzled.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In New Zealand, Kyle practices his boomerang skills on the beach, but it gets carried away into the forest. While searching for it, he stumbles upon two Yellow-Eyed Penguins in the middle of the forest with one shooing the other away. Puzzled by their presence, Kyle contacts the Junior Rangers, who, in the Garden, are dealing with Heros impatience for his repaired jetpack. During the call, they learn that the penguin might be looking for its nest but suddenly, it scurries off towards the beach. The team travels to New Zealand in PlatypusOne to assist Kyle and the penguin but it’s nowhere to be found now. They try to figure out where the nest could be while the poor lost penguin checks nests of other penguin and gets shooed off everytime. As an attempt to look for it better, they use their jetpacks, and Kyle climbs a tree to search from higher ground but discovers no leads. With help from Ranger Rocky and information from Ranger Joey, they decide to look inland and use PlatypusOne to search from a birds’ eye view and eventually, they successfully locate the penguin’s fledgling and nest which results in a heartwarming reunion. Back at the Treehouse, Leo hangs a picture of the new penguin friend, celebrating another successful wildlife rescue. Meanwhile, Hero, now equipped with a fixed jetpack, flies excitedly in the garden but gets himself stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the Alaskan wilderness, Jayden witnesses a grizzly bear cub being swept away in a river. Hero, Leo, and Katie, in the Garden, are practicing a search and rescue mission, with Heros flotation device when Jayden contacts them about the cub’s emergency. After a quick info segment about grizzly bears, they travel to Alaska in PlatypusOne. They try to chase after the cub but the river then divides into two ways. Unsure which way the cub went, the team split up with Katie and Hero flying ahead with their jetpacks to find the cub. Leo and Jayden then encounter Ranger Rocky who suggests they seek advice from Ranger Joey. Hero comes back to the boys and signals that he didn’t find the cub. Katie then joins them and warns them that the cub is approaching dangerous rapids. Hero is tasked to find the mother bear while the team rushes to the cub. When they reach the cub, it’s clinging to rocks as the rapids are pulling it away. They drop Heros flotation device and Hero practices his rescue skills, enabling the cub to safely reunite with its mother. Back at the Treehouse, they hang a picture of the rescued cub and its mom, concluding the successful mission and in the Garden, Hero is enjoying his well deserved time in the pool.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: In the park, Simon wants to impress Lou and her friend Sophie by playing superhero. But he comes to "save them" for the silliest reasons, and just about every minute, and each time it turns into a minor catastrophe. As a result, the girls have pretty quickly had enough of Simon, who on the other hand, doesn’t understand their reaction. And a good thing he doesn’t give up because when he saves the two girls from a big puddle of muddy water, he finally becomes a real superhero in their eyes!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, plays beautifully on his violin for the forest inhabitants, but one day, no one listens to his new piece. First, he looks for Berry, Balthazar, and Stanley, but they are busy. He goes to Dolly, but she doesn’t have time either. Very discouraged, he decides to leave the forest. However, he meets the Magpie, who welcomes him and cheers him up. Meanwhile, the others begin to search for Alfonso. When they find him, they apologize and invite him to play his new piece at the playground opening.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One autumn day, Reggie Squirrel is visited by his old friend, Otto Badger, who brings a frisbee as a gift. They happily play with it, and when they head home, the frisbee falls at the base of a tree. Later, Berry and his friends find it and play with it, but Balthazar throws it so far that the frisbee vanishes. Reggie Squirrel asks them about it later, but Balthazar denies having seen it. Dolly and Flutter find the frisbee and bring it back to Reggie. Berry, feeling ashamed, admits that they accidentally threw the frisbee and couldnt find it. In the end, they all play happily with it until dark, carefully making sure not to throw it too far.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its snack time for Bing so Flop suggests they make a smoothie. When Bings carrot accidentally gets put in the blender, hes upset to disover he cant have it back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing finds a frog in the garden, so he and Sula make the frog a house in a bucket.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to play his car park game, but Charlie is visiting and keeps messing it up.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop play shadow tag until it starts raining and Bings shadow is outside getting wet.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Ida asks Molly, if she can look after her duckling Alina. But today of all days, Alina wants to learn how to fly and gets herself in some risky situations – and so Molly has to take some risks too.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Mole mother Gertrud has a cold, so Tilda watches her kids. The children teach Tilda how to dig. Unfortunately, Tilda’s tunnel leads directly to Rupert, who’s upset about the molehills in his garden.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: New guests arrive at Guesthouse Appleseed – the famous band “The Merry Mice” and two hares who want to record birds singing. But with the mice practising their music, the hares can’t hear any birds.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse pick lots of delicious strawberries. Little Nutbrown Hare eats all his and runs out so Little Field Mouse shares hers with him. When he goes to collect some more for his friend he eats them all too. Little Field Mouse shows him how to eat them really slowly to make them last longer.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare makes a slippery slide from a pile of snow and has so much fun he decides to keep it a secret and play with it all by himself. But he soon gets bored playing by himself, and invites his friends to play. They build bigger and curvier slides together and slide faster and faster. Little Nutbrown Hare learns it’s lots more fun to shares the joy with his friends.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After Big Nutbrown Hare shows Little Nutbrown Hare a special place where his voice echoes, he and Little Field Mouse play a game of Try to find me with Little Redwood Fox and Little Grey Squirrel. They hide in the ravine and as their voices bounce off the rocky walls, their friends have a very tricky time trying to find them.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: The beach club has organized a potato sack race. Simon partners up with Maelle. But when Maelle gets injured during the race, its up to Gaspard to take her place.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers are on a quest to reunite a lost Malayan tapir with its mother. But their visit to the rainforest leads them to another encounter with… the Malayan tiger!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo chances upon a dawn bat while sketching in his garden. The Junior Rangers embark on a search after sundown for the dawn bat’s cave.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their Snow Rescue badges, Koko and Wilson have to rescue Zephie, who is pretending to be stranded. They start to bicker about the best way to do it, causing Zephie to tip over. Now they have to do a real rescue! They realise they will need to work as a team and, using Calley’s rescue wagon, they get Zephie back on her wheels and earn their badges.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Koko and Wilson have to load their cars with special blocks and bring them back to Vee without dropping any or leaving any behind. They think this is the easiest badge ever – until they see that the blocks are oddly shaped and won’t all fit into the cars! Eventually they realise that if they slot the blocks together to make cubes, they fit into the cars perfectly. They deliver the load to Vee and earn their badges!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina finds T’choupi’s baby sister Fanni so cute that she suggests they go out and find other "babies," in the hamlet. Launching a "baby quest," she and T’choupi come across a chick, a baby rabbit, a caterpillar and a little snail! Next, they head to the woods to find more babies. But T’choupi suddenly gapes as he spots the cutest young animal of them all: a baby hedgehog, also known as a "hoglet."

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Luce has brought one of T’choupi’s favorite games: a Seek And Find game based on Nature! Mom comes along and suggests they go for a walk in the forest. The kids love the idea… as long as we can bring the game with! Mom agrees. But on the way, Luce drops the game, losing some of the pieces. She doesn’t say anything to the others, but when the time comes to start playing, the missing pieces make it impossible to continue past a certain point! Oh nooo!! So Mom suggests they play Seek And Find for real, in the forest! The first one to find a chestnut, a hedgehog or a frog…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi loves picking vegetables in the vegetable garden! But when Mom asks him if he remembered to water the tomato plants, as per her request this morning, he freaks out: he was too busy having fun and forgot! In a mad rush, he gets Nina to help him find a way to keep Mom busy while he quickly waters the tomatoes. But it just doesn’t seem to work: the plants look positively sick!... But, what if there’s another way to tend to vegetables…?

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Anna introduces children to the unusual sound of the bassoon. The sound of this instrument is so distinctive that it reminds them of... an elephant! Seeing their delighted faces, Anna asks them to find objects in the school that make animal noises. While Ben and Lily find what theyre looking for, Charley is the only one to come back empty-handed... unless he has a surprise up his sleeve...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam got a wrong idea about what Julias life was like when she lived on her island. Julia try to show Sam by immersing him in a tropical atmosphere, reconstituted at the Mouse Mansion.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: To participate at the annual cheese hunt with the other children of the residence, Julia faces a problem : she has a cold and cant sniff anything. Sam is going to help her to play with them anyway!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Sidney is a very hard working diesel, but he’s also very forgetful. One day The Fat Controller gives him a very special job – Sidney needs to go to Brendam Docks to collect Percy’s new wheels. But when Sidney admits that he’s worried he might forget what he has to do, Thomas suggests making up a little song to help him remember. Sidney goes off happily singing a song about collecting a crate from Brendam docks, but when he stops to talk to Gordon he gets distracted, forgets what he’s supposed to be doing, and ends up at The Waste Dump looking for boilers then The Animal Park waiting for an elephant!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Christmas is fast approaching and it is the last chance for children to post their letters to Santa. Percy is collecting the mail, but there is a lot of snow on the rails and it isn’t easy to get through. Harold teasing Percy doesn’t help either, but when Percy runs into a snowdrift it is Harold who volunteers to take the letters for him. Percy is cross at having to be helped, but when Harold doesn’t come back it is Percy who goes to find out what happened and help him in return.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Its dress-up day at pre-school today; a day to wear whatever makes you feel good. But before everyone in the class gets stuck into their imagination and games - theyre thrown off by Jefferys choice of costume.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou spends a day at the park and plays with a dog named Pepper!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: It seems some sort of monster is causing havoc in Busytown Lake. The kids catch glimpses of it and find numerous finny footprints by the shoreline. However closer investigation reveals it to be Mr Fix-It’s latest invention – a swim fin-wheeled amphibious submarine car!/Huckle and his pals try to track down a bad driver.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is expecting a visit from his friend Frog; in the meantime he practices his leapfrog abilities. When Frog finally arrives Monkey has an even better idea, that they play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey thinks he’s got a scary roar although the fly that’s bothering him doesn’t seem to think so. Hearing his friend Lion, Monkey realizes that he needs to learn how to roar properly. With the ‘King of the jungle’s’ help Monkey plays his favorite game… Monkey see Monkey do!!

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Chaos ensues at Pontypandys first ever Country Market when Sarah and James try to outsell Mandy and Norman, causing apples to fly everywhere.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends

It’s only when they realize that the best way to help Goose lead is to let her lead, that the team gets back on track. / Franklin is a bit disappointed when clumsy Mr. Mole replaces clever Mr. Fox on their wilderness trip, but soon finds that Mr. Mole has many great wilderness skills if you give him a chance.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family

Indeed, this traditional holiday is all about giving gifts to those you love. The Twins are keen to make a present for Rosie. Thats great, but what should they do? Scoutbadger isthinking of something useful, while Woodsy leans towards something beautiful.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Bubble would like to see a new decoration in the jar and Doodleboo knows perfectly how to embellish it!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Its spring, the season of lovers and flowers! Sketcky would very much like to offer one to Bubble but first we need to let it grow and especially protect it against all kinds of threats. programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky would like to discover the secrets and hidden treasures of Mother Nature. But it is not the spider who weaves its web that can accompany him! Doodleboo has a Riddleboo that will do the trick...

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave go in search of Littlest Bunny’s missing cuddly carrot toy. They search all the places that Little Bunny has played that day, one by one, without success. It’s only when they have learned to look carefully and check big open spaces thoroughly, by walking slowly in lines from one side to the other, that they find it. They also find Penny Hen’s lost scarf, Herman the Hermit Crab’s beach bucket and Cindy Squirrel’s missing nuts!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave have fun at the Animal Day Parade. They decorate their Rollypod trailers, transforming them into colourful floats and give some of their animal friends a lift to the parade. The parade queen is chosen and everyone ready, until Sneezy Sheep’s giant parade balloon floats away! Hatty saves the day and proudly leads them all in the parade.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse innocently pick lots of Spring flowers from a field and deliver bunches to their friends. When they realise that they are being followed everywhere by a cloud of yellow butterflies, they realise that the butterflies need the flowers, to feed from their nectar. How will they lead the little butterflies to more flowers and sweet nectar?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One clear Spring night, Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse settle in to enjoy Little White Owl’s story of adventure and treasures. Inspired by her tale, the two set out to try and touch the most special treasure of all – a shiny star. They climb higher and higher but the beautiful stars seem just out of reach. Will they find a way to get their wish?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has enough money to buy one thing in Padgets shop but he finds it hard to choose between all the lovely things. After much deliberation Bing chooses a campervan but on the way home he begins to regret his decision.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its bedtime but wheres Hoppity? Bing remembers playing with him in the garden so Flop finds a torch and together they set off in the dark for an adventure.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, Stanley, Balthazar, Flutter and Bubble are hiking in the forest on a beautiful autumn day. Suddenly they recognized that someone is crying in the bush. They found a mushroom without his hat. The friends immediately start to help him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One spring day, Frank longhorn beetle visits his friend, Stanley. Frank suggests to organize a football match. Everyone wants to play football, the two teams get together quickly. The girls cheer on the sidelines. The game is about to start.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Easter is here. The girls: Dolly, Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr and Rosita gather and start to paint the Easter eggs. They happily work all day, painting beautiful eggs.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Ever tried making a hay tower? Well Monkey did only not very successfully and when it was time to clean things up he got some unexpected help from his friend the horse. Horse was eager to play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Fireman Sam
